title.$t: Issues - chromium
Tri-state content settings management on Clank (in general for mobile)

content.$t:
Chrome on Desktop allows three states for default in various content settings. This simplified in Clank into 2 states namely, enabled (either ASK or ALLOW) and disabled (usually BLOCK).

This breaks down when Policy sets Location to ALLOW whereas it is a ASK:BLOCK pair on Clank otherwise.               .............[1]
Another consideration is if we want to add Sync support for Settings to Android/mobile.                              .............[2]

In the short term, perhaps a solution like crrev.com/1040293003 where we show the third state to the user but do not allow setting that value could solve [1], on the other hand a tri-state UI which is simple to use would be another solution.

This is a UI bug to discuss why we prefer the present UI, considerations for/against a tri-state UI.

title.$t: Revert wpa_supplicant update from R42

content.$t:
wpa_supplicant was updated recently to version 2.3. R42 was branched with only the initial wpa_supplicant update commit, the subsequent patches were not included in R42.

Revert the wpa_supplicant from R42 to avoid any issues due to lack of the subsequent patches and give it more time in R43 to iron out any issues.

title.$t: Zoom accelerators not working in manual launch kiosk when Smart Lock is enabled
fcntl is poorly intercepted by nacl_io

content.$t:
fcntl is poorly intercepted by nacl_io
Because fcntl uses varargs, we don't have an irt interface for it.
As a consequence, we don't have runtime hooks to intercept it, and instead rely on link order.
This can be problematic in the face of various build systems in the naclports.

We should probably do one of:
- provide libc interception for fcntl, independent of the constraint on irt interfaces
- provide a fcntl header that #defines fcntl to an alternate name that we can robustly provide. This could be done in glibc-compat for newlib, but it's unclear where to put this for glibc
- provide an nacl_io_fcntl with varargs in nacl_io, so that -Dfcntl=nacl_io_fcntl can be passed to affected builds in naclports.

This issue affects at least (possibly more):
blackbox
emacs
x11
gawk

title.$t: chromeos=1 build on Linux fails at gyp_chromium step due to missing remoting_it2me_host_static target

content.$t:
Locally on my Linux machine, if I have the following in my ~/.gypi/include.gypi file:
{
  'variables': {
    'chromeos': '1',
    'component': 'shared_library',
    'clang': '1',
  },
}
and run python build/gyp_chromium.py
...I get the following error:
gyp: Dependency '/media/dmichael/src/builds/chromium/src/remoting/remoting.gyp:remoting_it2me_host_static#target' not found while trying to load target /media/dmichael/src/builds/chromium/src/chrome/chrome.gyp:browser_extensions#target

This is somehow very dependent on how you provide gyp its environment. If I take the variables out of my include.gypi and run the following:
GYP_DEFINES="chromeos=1 component=shared_library clang=1" python build/gyp_chromium.py
...It works fine.

Alternately, if I add the following lines to my include.gypi file:
    'enable_remoting_host': '1',
    'enable_me2me_host': '0',
    'enable_it2me_host': '1',
...it works fine. (I cribbed those values from looking at https://codereview.chromium.org/906463005)

garykac: Is it possible that your change introduced some kind of ordering problem for gyp?

title.$t: Improve Android logs in Java

content.$t:
Logging in Java is currently not as clear as it should be. The wiki[1] makes a recommendation, but it is not very closely followed throughout the code base. 

This means that unlike what the wiki recommends, most log statements are kept in the final binary, and there is no easy way to disable logs you are not interested in.

The second concern is related to the format of the logs:
Current native log: I/chromium ( 999): [INFO:foo_manager.cc(42)] info message
Current java log:   I/FooManager ( 999): info message

The native logs have a nice "chromium" tag, that differentiates it from other apps or system logging. Currently when looking at logcat, there is no indication showing which logs come from chrome (Java).

title.$t: ICU calendar stripping script leaves random calendars that should have been removed.

content.$t:
Bug in android/patch_locales.sh make the calendar stripping fail to remove some 10 KB of calendars. Problem is that EXTRA_CAL is not reset between iterations. Fixing this makes the android icu data file 6267872 bytes instead of 6277552 bytes.

No big deal if I manage to replace the current system with a gyp/gn system but I wanted it recorded. I found this because my work in progress produced a smaller package than the one committed to the repo.

title.$t: OOPIF: PageLoadHistograms should be updated to account for out-of-process iframes.

content.$t: As part of the Site Isolation project, we are enabling iframes to be hosted processes different than their parent one. This is a tracking bug for updating PLT histogram logic to support out-of-process iframes.

title.$t: Consider exposing style difference on style recalc to devtools or tracing

content.$t:
When trying to debug issues of layout performance (like b/19031338), a key question is what style exactly changed (i.e. was it just a transform or not).

During style recalc blink has a data structure describing the differences in style.  Couldn't we have a mode which dumps that out to devtools so a developer can see exactly which style properties were changed?  That seems like it really would help debug perf issues like this.

title.$t: firmware updater: single place for board configuration.

content.$t:
Currently when we want to add firmware updating to a new board, people have to:
 - create a virtual/chromeos-firmware in board-specific overlay
 - create chromeos/chromeos-fimrware-$board in board-specific overlay
 - if there are global changes, modify the cros-firmware.eclass

It's a painful process to write multiple ebuids again and again, especially when we want to do some global changes this will trigger thirty to 40+ (maybe fifty soon) changes.

To simplify this, there is a plan to migrate all board-specific stuff into single ebuild, just like chromeos-coreboot-$board changed to 'coreboot'.

The goal is to have single 'chromeos-base/firmware' and redirect virtual/chromeos-firmware to it.

title.$t: Streaming video on second monitor of dual monitor setup causing issues

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
any YouTube video

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open video through YouTube
2. Place video in second Chrome window on second monitor
3. Use browser as usual in original Chrome window on primary screen

What is the expected behavior?
Video should play smoothly and system should not be affected negatively.

What went wrong?
Problem #1 - If I stream video on my second screen (I'm using a laptop connected to a monitor via HDMI) it becomes extremely choppy and glitchy. It seems as if it is constantly rocking back and forth between  0.2 seconds of where it should be. So the video will move forward as it should, then it will jump backwards incrementally for a brief moment, after which it continues back to where it should be, repeat ad infinitum. The audio during all of this is fine.

Problem #2 - If I have 2+ windows of chrome open, one streaming video, and I move the streaming video window to the second monitor, my entire computer becomes sluggish. Not only chrome, but the entire computer. My CPU usage also skyrockets while the video is still loading - significantly more so than it doe if I let the video load on my primary laptop screen. However, this problem does not reoccur if I only have one chrome window open. However, the video does remain choppy as described in Problem #1.

Did this work before? Yes I'm not positive, but I believe it worked previously. Not sure when.

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? Both

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 8.1
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

Please see the following link in regards to troubleshooting already performed and more information on the problem in general:

https://productforums.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/chrome/s6MpMwFDGWc/3HcsqPox49cJ 

Thank you!

title.$t: Fix flakes in WebRTC browser tests

content.$t: Describe problem with existing test, or request for new test. The WebRTC browser tests have accumulated cruft, race conditions and crashes over the past few months, and need a cleanup to stop annoying sheriffs and provide reliable test results. A few possible reasons: * Tests have made incorrect assumptions, such as not correctly chaining callbacks. * Races and crashes have crept into the production code. * Config problems on the bots, such as busted audio configs etc. Set Cr-? to area of the system being tested. Set Test-? to type of test.

title.$t: URL bar disappears when new tab opened on small width browser windows

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.104 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Shrink screen width down very small, with lots of extensions in extension bar
2. Open new tab

What is the expected behavior?
URL bar doesn't dissapear

What went wrong?
When we shrink the screen width down very small (step1.png).

And then open a new tab, the URL bar no longer exists (step2.png)

This persists even when you make the browser window bigger again (step3.png)

Did this work before? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.104  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: One of the language name is seen as blank on 'Gmail Account Settings' page

content.$t: Chrome Version : 43.0.2351.3 (Official Build) 010a642e52f6982612f1ed0d6c50f70df0ae709d-refs/branch-heads/2351@{#4} (32/ 64-bit) OS : Windows(Win7 Aero enabled) Precondition: Login to gmail with valid credential. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Launch chrome, navigate to 'gmail.com' and click on 'Profile icon' from top R.H.S of the page, it will open 'profile info overlay'. 3) Click on 'Account' link and then 'Language' from 'Personal info' section. 4) Click on 'Add another language', it will open 'select language' overlay. scroll down the overlay and observe. What is the expected result? All of the language names should be display properly. What happens instead? One of the language name is seen as blank. Note: This is Windows specific non-regression issue, observed from M-28 , version-28.0.1466.0. Previously 'select language' overlay doesn't have scroll bar hence unable to see the languages. Note: Issue is not seen on Linux and Mac OS. i.e Language is seen properly.

title.$t: DevTools: move input domain handling to browser

content.$t:
With cross-process subframes, we cannot inject events in blink, since those will not go cross-process.
Instead, dispatching event from browser will make this work.

1. Open 'https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/content_scripts#pi'.
2. Hover on the first code block. When we hover on it, it is showing 'backgroung.html' instead of 'background.js'
3. 

What is the expected behavior?
It should show 'background.js' on hover instead of 'background.html'.

What went wrong?
I hope this is auto generated markup. In the markup i can see 
<pre data-filename="background.html" class="prettyprint">
.....
</pre>

but it should be 
<pre data-filename="background.js" class="prettyprint">
.....
</pre>

Please have a look at the attached image.

title.$t: Pointer lock should use the permission bubble

content.$t:
Right now, pointer lock uses a fullscreen-style prompt (see attachment). It seems like this should be a normal permission bubble.

scheib@, do you know any reason why this isn't a normal permission request?

title.$t: DCHECK failure in LatencyInfoSwapPromiseMonitor::OnForwardScrollUpdateToMainThreadOnImpl

content.$t: Version: ToT r322807 OS: Linux What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to https://stripe.com/checkout 2. Scroll down with mouse wheel What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Sometimes I see a DCHECK failure: DCHECK(new_sequence_number != it->second.sequence_number); After some investigation, it looks like the sequence number that's already in |latency_components| is coming from: #1 ui::LatencyInfo::AddLatencyNumberWithTimestamp() #2 ui::LatencyInfo::AddLatencyNumber() #3 content::RenderWidgetHostLatencyTracker::OnInputEvent() #4 content::RenderWidgetHostImpl::ForwardWheelEventWithLatencyInfo() #5 content::RenderWidgetHostImpl::ForwardWheelEvent() #6 content::RenderWidgetHostViewAura::OnMouseEvent() #7 content::RenderWidgetHostViewAura::OnMouseEvent() #8 ui::EventHandler::OnEvent() #9 ui::EventTarget::OnEvent() #10 ui::EventDispatcher::DispatchEvent()

title.$t: Incorrect dead key down event code/string on freon (NaCl)

content.$t: Version: Chrome OS 6885.0.0 peppy (freon) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set Chrome OS keyboard layout to US INTL 2. Open kiwi (crouton in tab) 3. Press any dead key (e.g. Quote '): it needs to be pressed twice to get it displayed (no matter the keyboard layout chosen in crouton). xiwi debug output (C is key_event.GetCode().AsString(), JSKC is key_event.GetKeyCode()) debug:(0) 774 Key DOWN: C:, JSKC:e5 => KC:0 (KEY UNKNOWN!) searchstate:0 debug:(1) 858 Key UP: C:Quote, JSKC:de => KC:30 searchstate:0 So we only get the key string/code on release... Pressing the key a second time leads to correct event: debug:(1) 757 Key DOWN: C:Quote, JSKC:de => KC:30 searchstate:0 debug:(1) 859 Key UP: C:Quote, JSKC:de => KC:30 searchstate:0 As far as I can tell, it worked fine as of 6592.2.0 (see https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=425156#c16), the current behaviour is similar to what we observe under Chrome OS/X11, and also described in issue 144038.

title.$t: Upstream tests of video casting feature

content.$t: Cast has now been upstreamed, but the tests are still downstream (in the Chrome for Android repository). They should be upstreamed.

title.$t: 1.8%-59.6% regression in webrtc_perf_tests at 8709:8711

content.$t:
Causes a bunch of improvements and some regressions in webrtc_perf_tests. Please check if they're what you expected.

commit 86639737b83d8877abc4810100e30a8af863189d
Author: pbos@webrtc.org <pbos@webrtc.org>
Date:   Fri Mar 13 00:06:21 2015 +0000

    Remove thread id from ThreadWrapper::Start().
    
    Removes ThreadPosix::InitParams and a corresponding wait for an event.
    This unblocks ThreadPosix::Start which had to wait for thread scheduling
    for an event to trigger on the spawned thread, giving faster Start()
    calls.
    
    BUG=4413
    R=tommi@webrtc.org
    
    Review URL: https://webrtc-codereview.appspot.com/43699004
    
    Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#8709}
    git-svn-id: http://webrtc.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@8709 4adac7df-926f-26a2-2b94-8c16560cd09d

title.$t: misalignment between execution line and the highlighted line for dynamically created functions

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.89 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. in a example page create a function in this way:
var fun = new Function('arg1', '//@ sourceURL=test.js \n console.log(1);\n console.log(2);\n console.log(3);');
and call it 
fun.call(this);
2. open devtools, find the test.js file in no-domain folder and put a breakpoint to the "console.log(3)" line
3. reload page

What is the expected behavior?
i'm expecting to see 1 2 in console and to stop with "console.log(3)" as highlighted line

What went wrong?
in console i see only 1 in console and the highlighted line is console.log(1)

Did this work before? N/A

i also tryed to use \r\n intead \n with same result

title.$t: Regression: Clicking thumbnail from print preview section of NTP does not navigate to the particular site.

content.$t:
Chrome Version: 43.0.2351.3 (Official Build) 010a642e52f6982612f1ed0d6c50f70df0ae709d-refs/branch-heads/2351@{#4} (32/64-bit).
OS: All (Win 7 Aero-Enabled).

Steps:
1. Launch chrome and open a NTP.
2. Give print command (Ctrl+P) on the NTP, in print preview section click on any of the thumbnails. 
3. Observe.

Actual: On clicking thumbnails from print preview section it does not navigate to the particular site.

Expected: Clicking the thumbnails from print preview should navigate to the particular site.

This is a regression issue broken in M-39.

Narrow Bisect:
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/d4a0b1d5102a0fe01ea29f14c90a28afc87da95c..20046cce16dbe711b7a5ee45f41a8d46caeb6d3b?pretty=fuller&n=100

Suspecting: 181070

Please re-assign if your change is not cause of the issue.

title.$t: gn: Parser::BinaryOperator clobbers more helpful/specific error messages

content.$t:
This code:
        rebase_path(icu_data_vars.icu_data_brkitr_res_root_filtered_sources + icu_data.vars.icu_data_brkitr_res_filtered_sources,
"..",
".")

resulted in this error message:

ERROR at //third_party/icu/gn_data_build_system/BUILD.gn:1131:65: Expected right hand side for '+'
        icu_data_vars.icu_data_brkitr_res_root_filtered_sources + icu_data.vars.icu_data_brkitr_res_filtered_sources,

The error in the source here is that "icu_data.vars" should have been "icu_data_vars". The error message that the right hand side of + is missing is misleading.

title.$t: cache.match returns a network error if cache.put is called with a Response with non-2xx status

content.$t: Version: r322984 What steps will reproduce the problem? Test code: cache.put(new Request('http://example.com/a'), new Response('', {status: 404})) .then(function() { return cache.match('http://example.com/a'); }) https://codereview.chromium.org/1047843003/ What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Actual: Response with type='error', status=404, statusText='OK'. Expected: ? I'm not sure what is the expected result, but the actual result seems inconsistent with the spec of a network error: > A network error is a response whose status is always 0, status message is always the empty byte sequence, header list is always empty, body is always null, and cache state is always "none". https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-network-error Cause: createFetchResponseDataFromWebResponse()

title.$t: Scroll events dispatched asynchronously unless there is an (empty) mousewheel event

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:36.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/36.0

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Have tall page, and a DIV (part of the flow) with a background image
2. On scroll even, using javascript, increase the top offset of the background image
3. Scroll with the wheel/touchpad

What is the expected behavior?
Smooth scrolling, as if there was a mousewheel event attached.

What went wrong?
Scroll event is dispatched asynchronously and this causes a shuddering of the image (DIV gets moved by the scroll, then after a brief delay, the scroll event is fired and JS reacts and moves the image)

This whole exprience changes if there is at least one (empty) mousewheel event listener.

Did this work before? Yes 35-36

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.104 (64-bit)  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.10
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

title.$t: Cache calls to CommandLine::HasSwitch(kWhitelistedExtensionID) in SimpleFeature.

content.$t:
In a typical startup, CommandLine::HasSwitch(kWhitelistedExtensionID) is called ~1000 times. It is the most common switch lookup, the second being kAppsGalleryUpdateUrl at ~300 times.

At the moment, these lookups are still fairly expensive since they allocate a std::string from the string constant. When the switch exists, GetSwitchValueASCII() allocates another copy.

Since the process command line is read-only, we should cache this lookup somehow, or provide a whitelisted extension in another way.

title.$t: Missing enum validation for Sequence (or Array) values
An unrelated website can affect which favicon is used by another website

content.$t:
Repro steps:
1) Navigate to https://x20web.corp.google.com/~pkotwicz/change_favicons/changer.html
2) Navigate to https://x20web.corp.google.com/~pkotwicz/change_favicons/chameleon.html

chameleon.html has two favicons small_a.png which is 16x16px and large_a.png which is 512x512px
Expected:
The favicon in the tab is the 16x16px one.
Actual:
The favicon in the tab is the 512x512px one.

- Refreshing chameleon.html makes it take on the 16x16px icon
- chameleon.html takes on the 16x16px icon if it was ever visited prior to visiting changer.html

This bug occurs when:
There is no mapping between chameleon.html to an icon URL but there is an icon mapping between a different page and one of the icon URLs listed in chameleon.html

title.$t: empty_response -324 network error when opening https://github.com/logout

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:31.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/31.0 Iceweasel/31.5.0

Example URL:
https://github.com/logout

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Log in to Windows as a new user for the first time.
2. Run Chrome.
3. Type "github.com/logout" without quotes in the address bar.

What is the expected behavior?
A github page with the sign-out confirmation button.

What went wrong?
A Chrome message pane showed an EMPTY_RESPONSE error.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 34  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: 

I could not reproduce the empty response with the HTTPS URL https://github.com/logout, but it is the latter that showed up in our Selenium tests on Chrome/Windows.

The error with the HTTP URL may or may not be related to GitHub replying to http://github.com/logout with 301 or 302 and "Location: /logout" from time to time instead of the full HTTPS URL.

Trying new --user-data-dir directories, new --user-name names did not help reproduce the issue.

title.$t: Keyboard gets wrong once switch Input method in OPT input window

content.$t: Chrome Version: 6.5.1.6 Chrome OS Version: Version 43.0.2347.0 canary 64-bit Chrome OS Platform: 6929.0.0 Firmware Google_Clapper 5216.199.7 Steps To Reproduce: 1. Go to OPT input window. 2. Hide the pop-up Mini digital keyboard (screenshot #1). 3. Switch to any other Input method (e.g. US International keyboard) from lower-right system menu. Expected Result: It's always the Mini digital keyboard displays. Actual Result: It's not the Mini digital keyboard displays (screenshot #2). Keyboard is still wrong even if i switch back to the default input method (US keybaord).

title.$t: Remove tests against SH_WEBGL2_SPEC and gfx::GetGLImplementation() in shader_translator.cc

content.$t: In Issue 470396 and https://codereview.chromium.org/1038763004/ it was pointed out that check against SH_WEBGL2_SPEC when deciding to use the GLSL core profile is a hack and should be removed. One solution for this would be to use the core profile on all platforms where desktop GL is used.

title.$t: Regression: console frame switcher can't be closed

content.$t:
On ToT, the console frame switcher cannot be closed without selecting a value.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open console.
2. Click frame switcher drop down

Expected:
- Clicking arrow should close.
- Clicking outside of menu should close.

Actual:
Can't click anywhere in Chrome UI expect within the menu to select a frame.

title.$t: DevTools: Timeline filtering shows unrelated events

content.$t: Version: 43.0.2351.3 / Canary OS: OSX What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Record some timeline events 2. Filter on "style" 3. Notice "Finish Loading" events, along with many non-style events. I think we're seeing loading events related to stylesheets but there's no indication that is occurring. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expected to only see style-related events (recalculate style) and possibly the chain of events that caused the style events.

title.$t: Layout tests with --single-process does not initialize directdraw on windows

content.$t:
On Windows, run layout tests with:

additional-drt-flag="--single-process" fast/parser/open-comment-in-style.html

Test will fail because text output is incorrect due to subpixel text not being enabled.

Understandably, RendererMain() is never called, so a bunch of init functions are never called, including platform.PlatformInitialize(), which would normally calls blink::WebFontRendering::setUseDirectWrite(use_direct_write) on Windows.  Since this is skipped, directwrite is not used, and as a result, subpixel text positioning is not used.

title.$t: dropdown entries misaligned, only partially visible

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Ubuntu Chromium/41.0.2272.76 Chrome/41.0.2272.76 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=365531

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. click on dropdown (click on the Search dropdown for the URL provided to reproduce the behavior)
2. The choices may not be visible when the dropdown is expanded.  Clicking and then unexpanding the dropdown and using the down arrow allows a single choice to be selected but not with the dropdown expanded.

What is the expected behavior?
Clicking on a dropdown should expand the menu and allow items in the dropdown to be reviewed (possibly scrolled through) and selected.  Often the choices are misaligned/offset and sometimes so misaligned they're not even visible. 

What went wrong?
An essential component is not behaving properly.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? N/A 

Did this work before? Yes I don't know.

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.76  Channel: n/a
OS Version: ubuntu 14.04 LTS
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Thanks.

title.$t: Improve translate prompt suppression logic

content.$t: The translate bubble today will stop showing if the user says 'no' ~3-4 times, for any language. We'd like to update that logic to be language-specific, so that a user has to say 'no' ~3-4 times for a given language for Chrome to stop prompting for that language.

This is a tentative diff range: http://chromeos-images/diff/report?from=6812.0.0&to=6812.34.0

Right now the lab is down so can't confirm this on other _IVB freon boards and can't be sure is this is related to Freon.

Adding freon dev in case they can check the diff and confirm.

"error", "working" and "done" pages should use the new UI

title.$t: queuing_duration metric doesn't need to take into account multiple begin_main_frame_events anymore

content.$t: Since https://codereview.chromium.org/337693005/ landed, there should be a 1:1 correspondence.

title.$t: Eliminate use of dedicated host registry service for remoting

content.$t: Remoting current relies on a single-purpose registry service to record information about each user's shared hosts.  This service can and should be phased out in favor of a general-purpose device registry service.

title.$t: g_markup_escape_text / XmlEncode crashes with invalid inputs

content.$t:
g_markup_escape_text expects an UTF-8 valid string, otherwise it crashes.
Some strings included in the XML request can contain invalid UTF-8 strings if data is corrupted. We would like to update even in those conditions instead of crash.

title.$t: make gles2_conform_test work fully in a GN build

content.$t:
gles2_conform_test depends on internal test files to build fully (with all the tests as per the GYP setting  for internal_gles2_conform_test==1).

We can check in a skeleton of the target that builds mostly, but it won't be complete until someone with access to the full internal code can implement and verify the rest.

Ken, is this target run on the main bots, or otherwise used more often than the khronos suite we filed bug 471903 for? If so, let me know and I'll help get it ported faster.

title.$t: Layout tests do not kern text the same way in SW and GPU
Remove notion of implicit inital values

content.$t: We currently have the notion of an 'implicit' initial value in Blink, which describes a value of 'initial' which arose from being not explicitly specified in a shorthand. This should have no difference from just specifying 'initial', so we should remove this concept.

content.$t:
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/00ec6e06ec9df0557f2f6f6f801253779e974f69/ash/ash_chromeos_strings.grdp

Can we change:

The extension "<ph name="EXTENSION_NAME">$1<ex>Nexus S</ex></ph>" can configure this network.

To:

The extension "<ph name="EXTENSION_NAME">$1<ex>Nexus S</ex></ph>" can help connect to this network.

The string is easier for people to understand.

title.$t: Tab capture on Mac is continuously janky

content.$t:
Link to screen capture that demos the problem: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_YwplQiISOBd1Zxbzk4bWdIV3c/view?usp=sharing

A recent change to glFlush() timing on Mac seems to have regressed tab capture.  There's a lot of jank and it seems an occasional old frame is being captured out-of-order.

I used bisect-builds.py to find this range: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/c119681f52423aa23d8d94857c979ed3203b571f..9339a6377c2aa5b4089456540966678da945fb26

...and when I revert the following change on my local build, the jank goes away completely: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/686075bc7bc8a36db87da7824544e0ccc512bf56

Repro steps:

1. Install attached self-mirroring.zip extension.
2. Download attached static-animation-transitioning-canvas.html file and open in a tab.
3. Click "purple hello globe" to start mirroring.  This opens a 2nd tab that plays back the 1st tab's captured video.

title.$t: suspend stress test code shouldn't consider early wakeup from power supply sources an error

content.$t:
In kernel 3.12 upstream, the following change landed:

commit 948dcf96622814d2a850a12851d27824530a9747
Author:     Zoran Markovic <zoran.markovic@linaro.org>
AuthorDate: Fri Aug 2 13:38:02 2013 -0700
Commit:     Anton Vorontsov <anton@enomsg.org>
CommitDate: Tue Aug 27 18:42:48 2013 -0700

    power_supply: Prevent suspend until power supply events are processed
    
    This patch, originally authored by Arve Hjonnevag and Todd Poynor,
    prevents the system from entering suspend mode until the power supply
    plug, unplug, or any other change of state event is fully processed. This
    guarantees that the screen lights up and displays the battery charging
    state. The implementation uses the power supply wakeup_source object.
    
    Cc: David Woodhouse <dwmw2@infradead.org>
    Cc: Arve Hjonnevag <arve@android.com>
    Cc: Todd Poynor <toddpoynor@google.com>
    Cc: John Stultz <john.stultz@linaro.org>
    Signed-off-by: Zoran Markovic <zoran.markovic@linaro.org>
    Signed-off-by: Anton Vorontsov <anton@enomsg.org>

That causes us to call pm_stay_awake() and hold the device awake for a while after each power_supply_changed() call, which happens in devices like SBS Battery, bq27500, etc.

--

We are seeing tests like Runin.SuspendResume and suspend_stress_test reporting errors because they got the battery gas gauge as an early wake event.  

--

We should do one of:

* Decide that we don't care about holding the device awake (since on all of our current systems the EC handles the charging LED).

* Whitelist battery IRQs and don't consider them errors.

* Add code that holds the device awake for some instances of power_supply_changed() but not others.  We don't really care if the battery capacity changed, the battery stopped charging because it hit 100%, or some other minor event happened.

--

Looking for an owner...

title.$t: WiFi autottest: Add conflicting-HT Info test

content.$t:
There are two distincnt places where an AP probe response and beacon indicate the currennt operating channel in 802.11n:

  - The "DS Info" information element, which displays the operating
    channel both for 802.11n and traditional a/b/g networks.
  - The "HT Info" information element, which displays both the
    "center operating frequency" and where the secondary frequncy
    is relative to this center.

Some APs send either corrupt beacons or probe requests where the HT
info field contains an invalid "HT Info" information element in the beacon.  In this situation the "center frequency" is usually set to an invalid value, somewhat similar to issue 208428.

We should create an autotest which modifies beacons to have an invalid HT Info element (similar to network_WiFi_SimpleConnect.checkTruncatedBeacon), and ensures that the client does not repeatedly disconnect as a result.

Initially assigning this as a low-pri item for rpius@.  This test will yield interesting information, but is a fair amount of work for that little information.

title.$t: Managed installation of private enterprise (unlisted) packaged extension in Kiosk Mode

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/39.0.2171.99 Safari/537.36
Platform: 6680.64.0 (Official Build) stable-channel daisy

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Configure 'Force-installed Apps and Extensions' under 'Public Session Settings' to install unlisted extension.  Said extension works fine when forced installed under 'user settings'.

2. Login to kiosk mode (not single app kiosk mode)

3. Extension is not force installed, only apps are installed.  

4. Attempts to manually install app give error "extension ID blah is not allowed in this type of session"

What is the expected behavior?
Extension is force installed in Kiosk mode, just the same as in user mode.

What went wrong?
Nothing is shown in console, not aware if this is supported behaviour, but can't see why it wouldn't be since apps can be force installed in kiosk mode, so why not extensions? (especially when they're private unlisted enterprise extensions, controlled by an enterprise admin).

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.89  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6680.64.0
Flash Version: 16.0.0.305-r1

title.$t: Is option NOGOOGLEUPDATEPING=1 still supported for MSI installer?

content.$t: Version: M31, M41 OS: Windows What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download Chrome MSI from: https://www.google.com/work/chrome/browser/ 2. Run command 'msiexec /i GoogleChromeStandaloneEnterprise.msi NOGOOGLEUPDATEPING=1 /l*v log.txt' 3. Installer is stuck there. From router, I can see it tries to contact Google server. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? 1. Per https://www.chromium.org/administrators/common-problems-and-solutions Appending 'NOGOOGLEUPDATEPING=1' to MSI command will instruct the installer to not contact google update server. However, per tests above, it still does so. 2. Doing a code search on https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#/, it returns no result for 'NOGOOGLEUPDATEPING', which makes me wondering whether this option is still supported. Can you clarify: - Whether option 'NOGOOGLEUPDATEPING=1' to MSI installer is still supported? - If yes, how to explain the behavior of test above? - If not, we need to revise articles to correct the outdated information. Here's some links for our records: * https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1628156?hl=en * https://www.chromium.org/administrators/common-problems-and-solutions * https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/3204698?hl=en

title.$t: make khronos_glcts_tests work fully in a GN build

content.$t:
The GYP build of khronos_glcts_tests requires a bunch of internal-only code to run.

We can build a skeleton implementation of the binary in GN without needing the internal-only code, but we need to do the additional work to support the full internal build in GN as well (i.e., we need the equivalent of internal_khronos_glcts_tests==1).

title.$t: Differentiate error from info or debug media log messages in chrome://media-internals

content.$t:
MSE parse log messages (and some FFmpeg log messages) are all currently shown as "error" property type in the chrome://media-internals log for the player.

Many of these are not truly error messages, nor are specific to MSE.
This bug tracks making the log messaging to chrome://media-internals more generic to media (not just MSE), as well as enabling differentiation of message by severity buckets (error, info, debug).

title.$t: extensions::Dispatcher::DidCreateScriptContext can be called with a null document URL

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Add some logging to extensions::Dispatcher::DidCreateScriptContext which prints out whether the document has a null URL, i.e. frame->document().url().isNull() 2. In a window, create a window with some src, then immediately postMessage to it What is the expected output? What do you see instead? DidCreateScriptContext should ideally always be called when the document has a URL. Note that null URL != blank URL. The former is a lack of a URL entirely, and causes bugs for us (extensions), the latter is about:blank and we can handle that just fine. null URL does not necessarily imply blank URL. Sample code: C++: Dispatcher::DidCreateScriptContext(frame...) { if (!frame->document().url().isNull()) LOG(ERROR) << "frame is null"; } JavaScript (make sure popups are enabled): (function() { var w = window.open(location.href); w.postMessage('hi', location.origin); })(); The discussion on https://codereview.chromium.org/983883004/ looks like it's a bug, or working-as-intended-but-it's-not-great. At the very least Extensions need a way to work around this, because we need to be able to create a wrapper for a v8::Context - extensions::ScriptContext - and have it never change - before any code executes. A couple of ideas: - introduce an event for a URL being ready. I tried just looping and making the whole thing async, and it works, but... ugh. event would be nicer. - introduce an event for when script execution actually starts. there must be a URL then. Putting the site isolation label here because that's what it's blocking.

title.$t: DingDong: support type-C monitors

content.$t:
DingDong's firmware currently only handles the DP monitor to Type-C device case.
By spec, the dongle should work in reverse as well.

title.$t: double finger double tap to zoom should update the zoom info area in the address bar

content.$t: Chrome Version : 43.0.2351.0 OS Version: OS X 10.10.3 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. double tap with two fingers somewhere on a page What is the expected result? there to be some indication that the browser made this change, rather than the website What happens instead of that? nothing Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. The new double tap to zoom behaviour is _awesome_. I love it. But I found it accidentally, and didn't realize it was chrome that did it (I thought it was the website). Since Cmd-0 resets the zoom, as though I had Cmd-+ed up until that point, it would be cool if the area showing the current page zoom was updated to indicate that chrome had zoomed in, rather than the site A slightly worse issue is that if you do zoom (via Cmd-+) after double tapping, the zoom percentage displayed starts off at 100 (e.g. far smaller than the actual zoom amount is). If you Cmd-0 to reset the zoom level, it takes you back to full unzoomed mode. This behavior makes sense, but the experience seems inconsistent without the UI saying "you are zoomed in". UserAgentString: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_3) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/43.0.2351.0 Safari/537.36

Unpack the zip file. 2. Start a local web server, ex. python -m SimpleHTTPServer 3. Load the html-benchmark.html What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Safari runs this 2x faster, seemingly because they don't spend so much time in GC. Firefox seems to run it in about the same time as Chrome. Chrome 43.0.2351.0 markup size: 29003050 domparser time: 996 frag nodes: 451800 WebKit nightly markup size: 29003050 domparser time: 545 frag nodes: 451800 Even ignoring the difference in performance between Safari, it's very confusing where the garbage comes from, the code doesn't seem like it should create any.

title.$t: Document all key combos that can result in restarting/crashing/etc

content.$t:
There are several key combos that can result in a machine restarting, crashing the browser, etc. We need a single comprehensive list of these to better be able to discuss their operation. We're particularly concerned about things that affect kiosk mode.

The ones I know off the top of my head:
Short hold power : Sign out
Hold power : Safe power off
Long hold power : Force power off
esc+refresh+power : Reboot
short hold esc+refresh+power : Enter recovery mode
ctrl+shift+q twice : Sign out
alt+volup+x : Kill running shell

afakhry@ can you try to collect any others in a doc?

content.$t: Version: TOT (r322794) OS: Mac (probably all) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open a blank page 2. Observer browser process CPU usage What is the expected output? What do you see instead? CPU usage is ~2% forever. It should be 0% if we're not doing anything. I see that we're posting a cc::DelayBasedTimeSource::OnTimerFired at every vsync. Trying to find when this regressed (haven't found it yet). We really need to get tests that prevent this sort of thing from happening -- the browser process should be idle when the user is doing nothing.

title.$t: Investigate multiple video frame upload in WebMediaPlayerMS

content.$t:
During MediaStream related <video> playback, class
WebMediaPlayerMS acts as adapter between the push
based model of MediaStream* classes and the pull model
of the Compositor render tree. 

On new frame arrival, WMPms::OnFrameAvailable() [1] is
touched, triggering a repaint via GetClient()->repaint().
The render tree refresh queries WMPms::GetCurrentFrame() 
[2] and gets are reference to the current Frame, 
returning it later on WMPms::PutCurrentFrame().

When we get N active <video> mediastream tag, however, 
every new OnFrameAvailable() ends in N GetCurrentFrame()s,
and all of them succeed in returning |current_frame_| [3].
Hence we have plenty of redundant frame uploads per
<video> tag.

For testing purposes this situation can be reproduced
locally or with any two way communications (apprtc etc). 
E.g. [4] can be used with two cameras connected -- it's
important that they are asynchronous, otherwise the
effect is less perceivable. 

--disable-gpu-vsync allows for even more fun.

FTR VideoFrameProviderClientImpl is the class calling
WMPms::GetCurrentFrame() [5].

[1] https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/content/renderer/media/webmediaplayer_ms.cc&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=478&rcl=1427715857
[2] https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/content/renderer/media/webmediaplayer_ms.cc&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=460&rcl=1427715857
[3] https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/content/renderer/media/webmediaplayer_ms.cc&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=468&rcl=1427715857
[4] http://goo.gl/fUcIiP
[5] https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/cc/layers/video_layer_impl.cc&sq=package:chromium&type=cs&l=89&rcl=1427730150

title.$t: `.select()` on input/textarea does not scroll it into view

content.$t: Chrome Version : 41.0.2272.104 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open the attached test case in Chrome 2. Find the the lowest set of buttons in the currently-visible viewport 3. Click the "select" button of this set to select the textarea contents below (which also focuses said textarea) What is the expected result? As when clicking the "focus" button, the textarea should be scrolled into view if necessary. What happens instead? On desktop Chrome (at least: OS X MAVRIX), the behavior of "select" is different than the behavior of "focus" the element is *not* scrolled into view when using the "select" button as it should be. In Android Chrome [barring other bugs] both methods cause scroll into view when necessary.

title.$t: Fix Location Settings UI on Android when it is set to 'ALLOW' by policy.

content.$t:
Most Content Settings only support two values by default namely enabled (either ALLOW or ASK) and disabled (usually BLOCK).

However Location Setting can be set to ALLOW by policy even though it is usually an ASK:BLOCK pair.

Support this properly in the Chrome on Android Settings UI.

title.$t: Move audio config files to board overlays

content.$t:
When new board variant is created, adhd ebuild might be broken when parsing the board name to search for config files. Moving audio config files to board ovarlays seems a better solution to automatically handle this.
e.g. Add a new ebuild chromeos-audio-config-pit and put it under 

~/trunk/src/overlays/overlay-variant-peach-pit/chromeos-base/

Then both peach_pit-freon, peach_pit, peach_pit-foo-bar can use this config.

title.$t: Need a Circular Activity Indicator View for the Mac

content.$t: There's a new (material) design for the Circular Activity Indicator View for the Mac. There needs to be a view class that can be added to a window to add one of these indicators.

title.$t: Simplify plural formatting with a direct use of the ICU message syntax

content.$t:
Chromium has used ICU's plural format for several years by building a message format understood by ICU at run-time by piecing together multiple messages for different numbers and adding ICU formatting characters. It started with special handling of 'remaining times' and was generalized to other messages by sammc in 2013. 

It has worked, but adding a plural message is a bit cumbersome. 6 messages for a logically single message have to be added [1]  and a caller has to pass a vector of 6 msg ids to GetPluralStringF*(). 

Moreover, special-casing 0, 1, or 2 [2] (or up to any number desired) requires adding if-clauses in the code in the current approach. 

Google's other products (which began to support general plural format after Chromium started doing so) including Android took a different approach. They directly use the ICU's message format for plural and gender. 

Chromium can do that, too. Translators are already familiar with the format  and it has yet another benefit of supporting gender (although I don't know yet of cases where we need to support gender in Chromium. Some extensions may want to). 

The only uncertainty about switching to this method is whether grit (and the corresponding grd  importer/exporter) 'interfere with'  any 'special characters' (such as open and closing braces) used in the ICU message syntax.  If not, I believe that we're good to go. 

Ref: 
1. http://userguide.icu-project.org/formatparse/messages
2. Google internal docs: 
   - go/plurals
   - http://goo.gl/KU9nwq (ICU syntax background)
   - http://goo.gl/rtuppQ (translator instructions)
  

[0] See ui/base/l10n/l10n_util_plurals.h/cc ( http://goo.gl/B5nFI8 )
[1] http://goo.gl/yh1jRC : An example of 6 strings 
[2] e.g. For 0, "You have no device attached" would be better than "You have 0 devices attached" in most circumstances.

title.$t: Optimize HPKP storage and matching

content.$t:
The HPKP storage currently creates a HashValueVector that is ordered based on the chain order, and contains both SHA-1 and SHA-256 values. However, we have a number of security checks (including HPKP) that wish to detect whether a given public key hash is within the list.

Rather than sorting in chain order, we could consider sorting this, to make the lookups easier and optimized.

title.$t: Implement pointer events behind experimental flag

content.$t:
Meta-bug to track work towards implementing the pointer events API.  Replaces issue 162757 which is mired in history around our changing position on this complex topic.  We'll file sub-bugs to track individual pieces of the work here.

Intent-to-implement:
https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!topic/blink-dev/ODWmcKNQl0I

Spec:
https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/pointerevents/raw-file/tip/pointerEvents.html

Initial discussion of the API change we want:
https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-pointer-events/2015JanMar/0041.html

Notes tracking implementation details:
https://docs.google.com/a/chromium.org/document/d/1keeTmtqTEFS6aQJuEDNpWwsR9qdBfYl8teE35fiTvqU/edit

title.$t: Add flag to disable window backdrops in TouchView

content.$t: Add a flag to allow disabling the translucent grey window backdrops used for windows which cannot be maximized in TouchView/maximize mode. Using this flag will allow the user to interact with windows other than the one currently at the top of the z-order.

title.$t: Variations string overrides doesn't work for all .grd files

content.$t:
Variations string overrides doesn't work for all .grd files.

The client-side implementation currently only handles strings in generated_resources.grd, which does not cover all strings that we may want to override.

For example, strings in google_chrome_strings.grd / chromium_strings.grd appear to not be handled. We should fix this to add the missing support.

Assigning to jwd@ for now, but cc'ing groby@ who's looking to expand this infrastructure. Rachel, feel free to grab this if you find cycles for this.

title.$t: Enable -fsanitize=cfi-*cast on Linux

content.$t: This tracks progress on enabling the low-overhead bad cast checks implemented in Clang documented at http://clang.llvm.org/docs/ControlFlowIntegrity.html

title.$t: Support toggling of local variables in the JS debugger

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.104 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
When you debug, Chrome will display local data in your code (https://twitter.com/kangax/status/581141432142041088/photo/1). This is cool, and you can disable the feature completely in settings, but if you want to quickly toggle it on or off, there isn't UI for that.

What is the expected behavior?
It would be nice to have a way to quickly toggle this feature on/off while looking at your code.

What went wrong?
See above.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 43.0.2351.0 canary (64-bit)  Channel: canary
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: ConditionVariable::TimedWait may overflow

content.$t: It looks like ConditionVariable::TimedWait may overflow when passed a large max_time.

title.$t: Prune dead code from prerender

content.$t: Per https://codereview.chromium.org/1048723003/, a TON of prerender code is dead since the field trials had expired and no one's actively working on it to monitor them anyway. This bug is to track the follow-up work to remove the orphaned code.

title.$t: Clean up org.chromium.content.browser.test.util.TouchCommon

content.$t:
org.chromium.content.browser.test.util.TouchCommon has a lot of related but subtly different functionality. Issue 471233 is an example of where this can cause problems where events are dispatched incorrectly causing flaky tests.

I think to the extent possible we want to send events directly to the view requested and not the root view.

title.$t: No Answer/Hangup key functionality in Chrome

content.$t: Chrome Version: all Chrome OS Version: all Chrome OS Platform: chromeos Network info: any Please specify Cr-* of the system to which this bug/feature applies (add the label below). Steps To Reproduce: 1. Use HID device which uses Telephony Usage page 2. Hit call answer and/or hangup buttons 3. Expected Result: The HID report sent to chrome should work within a Hangouts call for example, to answer or cancel a call. Actual Result: The HID reports are ignored How frequently does this problem reproduce? (Always, sometimes, hard to reproduce?) 100% What is the impact to the user, and is there a workaround? If so, what is it? The user has to use the hangouts app to hang-up a call, not the device. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screen shot or log if possible. Related to change https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/#/c/256411/ The HID reports 0x74 (Answer on/off), 0x26 (drop) and 0x20 (hook) should be handled similarly to 0x2F (mute) which is handled. There doesn't seem to be a key-code for answer/drop/hook but there is at least one keyboard handled by Linux that has buttons like that and is mapped to KEY_OK (answer) and KEY_CANCEL (drop). See drivers/hid/hid-lg.c for reference. Of course hangouts would need to handle those key-codes or (preferably perhaps) new explicit key-codes

content.$t: This came up as a TODO in the code review https://codereview.chromium.org/921223002/

title.$t: Add an API to execute contentscripts on page start during a navigate

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
chrome.tabs.update and chrome.tabs.executeScript does not give developers the ability to execute a content script on page start

What is the expected behavior?
Developers should be able to run a contentscript (similar to chrome.tabs.executeScript) but at page start.

What went wrong?
The callback from chrome.tabs.update is only called after a page has started loading and calling chrome.tabs.executeScript(..., { runAt: "document_start"}, ...) runs after some part of the document has already loaded.

Instead, if chrome.tabs.update() took an additional optional property of code or file (like executeScript does) then that script could be runAt document_start.

WebStore page: 

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Random crashes due to gfx::Image unsafe thread passing

content.$t:
gfx::Image has |storage_| member which is base::RefCounted, not thread safe. So passing around gfx::Image to other threads by copying is incorrect.

We noticed that twellington@'s recent, independent performance CL https://codereview.chromium.org/931993002/ makes this a lot more likely lead to random crashes, so this needs to be fixed.

There is chromium-dev discussion that noyau@ kicked off, but there is no consensus yet. https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!topic/chromium-dev/8LqVoXQ_2bo

title.$t: Web MIDI: implement clear() backend

content.$t:
MIDIOutput.clear() is not implemented in M-43.
To make it available,

1) Add Blink API for clear() operation.
2) Implement a common midi message scheduler that provide cancelation.

title.$t: Regression with PBKDF2/deriveKey

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Ubuntu Chromium/41.0.2272.76 Chrome/41.0.2272.76 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
crypto.subtle.importKey('raw', new Uint8Array([1,2,3]), {name: 'PBKDF2'}, false, ['deriveKey'])

What is the expected behavior?
A key is returned in promise

What went wrong?
DOMException: The requested operation is unsupported

Did this work before? Yes 14 Feb 2015

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.76  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: 

I was following http://blog.engelke.com/2015/02/14/deriving-keys-from-passwords-with-webcrypto/ for an example of how to use PBKDF2 since it's the most recent example I can find. At first I couldn't get it to work on my chrome, but I've realised that PBKDF2 isn't supported until chrome 42. Upon testing in chrome 42/43 I get the reported error above.

JS fiddles: 
https://jsfiddle.net/ty1c937d/2/
https://jsfiddle.net/p24qhsqm/4/

title.$t: Web MIDI: implement open() / close() backend

content.$t:
For now, open() and close() are implemented in Blink, but the device is not released actually.
To release the device correctly on Windows, we should do

1) Add Blink API for open() and close()
2) Introduce reference counting on two 1:N mux implementation.
3) Provide default implementations for all platforms that do nothing.
4) Implement Windows dependent open() and close()

title.$t: Remove GraphicsContext's compositing state

content.$t:
The current GraphicsContext global compositing approach is not only unnecessarily stateful, but it also presents some ill defined semantics: the compositing/blending mode (SkXfermode) is inherited by all subsequent beginTransparencyLayer() calls AND by all subsequent individual draw calls.  It is never clear whether the mode has already been applied onto an ancestor layer or it should be still applied on each paint => this can easily lead to double-blending/incorrect results.

As a general correctness rule, compositing/blending should only be applied atomically: either via a layer or (for trivial cases) by modifying the transfer mode of *a single draw call*. Neither of these approaches requires GC to track and propagate a global compositing state.

We should refactor the current clients to not rely on GC's compositing methods, and then get rid of them altogether.

title.$t: Geolocation Access Controls Not Sufficiently Granular

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.60 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Write JavaScript to access geolocation
2. Access page with above JavaScript
3. View scary prompt

What is the expected behavior?
Let the user decide granularity. Let the site know the general area without prompt.

What went wrong?
Geolocation on the web isnot optimal. So many sites trying to access location, scary prompt saying that site X wants to know your location with no context as to how it will be used, and too hard to revisit the decision.

Users will either blindly accept all requests for location, leaving them open to abuse, or they will deny all requests by default, eliminating any utility from geolocation.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.60  Channel: beta
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

Why is it either GPS within 15 feet or nothing at all? Many people don't care if you know that they're in San Mateo (for example), but unless you're explicitly a map-related or Foursquare-type web app, exact values aren't necessary but general location is still useful.

"Site wants access to your location."
 Allow
 Allow, but not my exact location
 Deny

Geolocation on the web is underutilized because people are worried about privacy, and rightly so! Speaking for myself, I'd be happy to give a value modulo 10km as a location default in exchange for not having a web prompt. Good enough to know the city for context but inexact enough to satisfy my comfort levels for general web use.

Also useful to amend the geolocation web API to specify needed granularity: exact, within 10km, within 100k, state/province/country, etc. If all your app needs is to know which requests are coming in by state or country, the privacy implications are obviously reduced from exact location.

title.$t: Do not respect always-on-top property for maximized always-on-top windows

content.$t: In both regular Ash and TouchView, do not respect the always-on-top property of windows which are maximized because this prevents the user from switching windows. See related discussion in issue 458141.

title.$t: "Command" key on external keyboard now maps to "Search / Caps Lock", not "Ctrl" as before

content.$t: Version: 42.0.2311.60 (Official Build) beta (64-bit) OS: Chrome OS What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Plug in an Apple keyboard into the USB port. I use the standard Apple wired keyboard 2. Select text and press Command + C to copy it (or do any other Ctrl+<key> shortcut) What is the expected output? The text is copied (or whatever other action is supposed to happen). That is, the Command key is considered a "Ctrl" key. What do you see instead? A "C" is pressed, and Caps Lock is now toggled on. (Note: in settings I have configured it so the "Search" key maps to Caps Lock. Even if I set that setting back to its default the problem still occurs) My muscle-memory is really deeply ingrained so this is tripping me up a lot. :-(

title.$t: Apply new logic for tray view during new gaia flow.

content.$t:
When adding a regular user:
- on the first card show three of the four options: Shut down, Browse as guest, three dot menu
- on all consecutive cards show only one option: Shut down

When adding a supervised user:
- on the first card show three of the four options: Shut down, Browse as guest,  Add Person
- on all consecutive cards show only one option: Shut down

title.$t: Keep app does not scroll well in TouchView with keyboard deployed

content.$t:
In TouchView, the virtual keyboard blocks a lot of the bottom of the keep app. If you want to see any of the bottom of a note popup or the bottom of the app for stuff like the undo bar, you have to scroll through all your notes.

=== 

There is change coming from bokan@ that changes the order in which viewports get scrolled, which might fix this. On me to check on that once it lands.

title.$t: Runningwarehouse.com expiration date filled incorrectly

content.$t: There's a single input for expiration date (MM/YY), but we're trying to fill the full year. What you end up with then is something like: "05/20". This is because they have maxlength="5" on the input. Perhaps this is something we could look at when making a fill decision?

title.$t: Port Hotrod shark controller to the new GAIA flow

content.$t:
This issue is about Hotrod shark<-->remora pairing flow.
This flow is not released yet and can only be activated by flag, however we want to keep it in a working state.

In order to make this flow work with a new GAIA, we need to teach |PolicyOAuth2TokenFetcher| to fetch two O2AT using a single auth code.

title.$t: Bookmark favicon can be permanently replaced by captive portal favicon

content.$t:
Repro steps:
1) Bookmark a site without a favicon (e.g. https://code.google.com/)
2) Find a starbucks
3) Click on your bookmark to "https://code.google.com/"
4) Notice that the browser is redirected to a captive portal terms of service page

Expected:
The bookmark's icon is not changed
Actual:
The bookmark's icon is permanently changed. There is no way of resetting it back to the default favicon.

The captive portal terms of service page is reached by clicking on a bookmark with a favicon, the favicon is still replaced, but it is fixed the next time that the site is visited

3.

What went wrong?
My summary: Most of my remote PC hosts now show as offline and unavailable for connection. 

On this PC, which was previously set up for remote control, the CRD app says "You must enable remote connections if you want to use Chrome Remote Desktop to access this computer."  For the moment, I am not trying to re-enable on this PC, since I am hoping that some auto-downloaded patch will solve the problem for all the PC's.

title.$t: add policy to disable dinosaur game on the network error screen on desktop/mobile platforms

content.$t:
http://crbug.com/462221 tracked a FR to block the dinosaur game on enrolled ChromeOS devices, but we have no policy-based way to block the game on other platforms (they can disable it via a cmd-line flag, but that's it).

We need to figure out how/if we want to address this - I can think of a few options:

0) Do nothing - let people figure out how to pass in a cmd-line flag on desktop platforms, and do nothing on mobile.
1) Add a platform/GPO policy to disable this - this doesn't cover mobile.
2) Do #1, plus add a cloud policy + MDM support to disable this (we probably should've done this to begin with, but this requires server-side involvement).
3) Do #1, and just automatically disable for anyone who is getting cloud policy (requires some work, because currently the implementation is per-chrome-instance, not per-profile). This doesn't help MDM-managed Chrome, however.

Assigning to Cyrus to triage/determine priority and the solution.

title.$t: CSP: Setting the src attribute of an audio element fails when connect-src is not allowed although media-src is set to *

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
This is the CSP I am using, media-src is set to 'self' *:

Content-Security-Policy:default-src 'none';script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval';style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline';img-src 'self' *;font-src 'self';connect-src 'self';media-src 'self' *;frame-src https://youtube.com https://www.youtube.com https://player.vimeo.com https://www.player.vimeo.com

media-src is defined in the following way https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/CSP/CSP_policy_directives#media-src

To reproduce the error, set the above mentioned CSP on your page and then open the JavaScript dev tools console and type the following:

var a = document.createElement('audio');
a.src = 'http://feeds.nature.com/~r/nature/podcast/current/~5/vIVmWoyt1ig/audiofile-2015-01-12.mp3';

What is the expected behavior?
Since media-src is set to * setting the src attribute using JavaScript should work fine. This works in Firefox btw

What went wrong?
I'm getting a CSP error: Refused to connect to 'http://www.nature.com/multimedia/podcast/nature/extras/audiofile-2015-01-12.mp3' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "connect-src 'self'".

Did this work before? N/A 

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: Archlinux
Flash Version:

title.$t: Leak in UrlFetchRequestBase.

content.$t:
Version: ToT
OS: ChromeOS

Few lines call RunCallbackOnPrematureFailure, but do not call sender_->RequestFinished(this). As a result, the request will not be released.

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/google_apis/drive/base_requests.cc&rcl=1427701968&l=281

title.$t: Regression: 301 redirect to data: URLs works

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Visit a URL that redirects to a `data:` URL, such as https://mths.be/data

What is the expected behavior?
In older Chromium versions, this resulted in Error 311 (net::ERR_UNSAFE_REDIRECT).

What went wrong?
abarth WONTFIXED an old bug asking to support this functionality, after a brief discussion on the potential security risks: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=64092#c15

Did this work before?
Yes, see bug 272072 and bug 64092.

title.$t: Zoom bubble is not seen proper on zoom in/out the page in fullscreen mode.

content.$t: Version: 41.0.2272.116 (Official Build) Revision f0cba560fb057900d1529b665f787cc9fb88a9ae-refs/branch-heads/2272@{#456} (64-bit) OS: Mac What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Launch chrome, open NTP, press 'Cmd+Shift+B' (to show bookmarks bar) and press 'Cmd+Shift+F' (to fullscreen the browser). 2) Now zoom in/out the page using Cmd + +/- and observe the zoom bubble at top. Zoom bubble is not seen proper on zoom in/out the page. Zoom bubble should be seen proper on zoom in/out the page. This is a Non-Regression issue seen from M-27 series (Chrome version: 27.0.1453.93). Note: Issue not seen on Windows and Linux OS.

title.$t: DevTools: CSS.mediaQueryResultChanged and Canvas.traceLogsRemoved are sent before enabled

content.$t:
1. Start with --remote-debugging-port=9222.
2. Open remote inspector.
3. Open DevTools for inspector, reload, see all messages in websocket.

title.$t: We should more leniently parse referrer policy data.

content.$t:
Reverting to `None` on parse failure is draconian, yes, but also makes introducing new syntax problematic. If we're going to do the subresource/navigational split, we're going to need to be a bit friendlier in order to ease upgrade cycles.

Dev has bugged me about this a few times now. :)

title.$t: umpire: integrate overlord

content.$t: Integrate overlord with umpire server. To do this, overlord need to be first bundled into factory toolkit, then umpire server should start overlord when starting itself.

title.$t: ChromeOS signin should tell Gaia when a session is ephemeral

content.$t:
Whether a given token is for an ephemeral session or not is a useful signal to Gaia (we can use it in various ways, such as changing default token lifetimes, presenting different UI in the token revocation flow, etc).

We need to modify the ChromeOS signin code (and possibly desktop as well?) to tell Gaia that this is an ephemeral session when minting our LST.

title.$t: Remote inspection is hard to debug due to permessage-deflate WebSocket extension

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
A recent stable release has enabled the use of permessage-deflate (seemingly on purpose here: 
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/13fbeece908a65fb7264a3ccc3ce522fb62c276f%5E%21/chrome/browser/devtools/device/android_device_manager.cc) which makes diagnosing issues and working with the devtools protocol incredibly difficult.

In particular, Wireshark does not yet support the decompression extension and I am not aware of any other convenient mechanism to visualize the traffic happening between phone and laptop.

To my knowledge, this compression offers no real advantage in practice as the devtools protocol on Android is almost exclusively used via USB which is a relatively high speed link (ADB over USB is capable of ~4-5MB/s in practice on real devices).

What is the expected behavior?
Wireshark should be able to inspect devtools protocol traffic between an Android phone and laptop to assist developers who work with the devtools protocol.

What went wrong?
I don't understand why this change went in and the review request appears to have no information or context.  I can only expect this was done for consistency with some other effort inside Chromium though it should be disabled for Android/devtools specifically due to no real benefit that I can see.

Did this work before? Yes Chrome 40.x did use this extension

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Low precision scrolling on touchpad with high precision support

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.60 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. On my Dell XPS 12 (Synaptics Clickpad 1.5, Synaptics Driver 18.1.45.6 RMIHID)
2. Open any Website that scrolls
3. Scroll

What is the expected behavior?
Scrolling with high precision, not in entire lines as with old mouse wheels

What went wrong?
Other Browsers / Programs (IE 11, Firefox 36) use high precision scrolling, so it is available on my hardware.
On an old laptop with same Windows 10, same Synaptics driver version but much older Synaptics PS/2 Touchpad the same Chrome version has high precision scrolling.
=> Chrome is capable of it, the hardware is capable, but Chrome seems to not detect high precision scrolling support on my specific hardware.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.60  Channel: beta
OS Version: 10.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

Rare and not reproducible: sometimes during driver updates, chrome had high precision scrolling for a few seconds before reverting back to scrolling in whole lines when driver update was complete.

title.$t: Update blackmagic SDK in Chrome

Currently it seems that the current Blackmagic SDK in Chrome is incompatible with the latest Blackmagic drivers.

As suggested in https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=347371#c35 we should update the SDK.

Another thing, how are we supposed to keep track of this in the future? This could potentially happen every Chrome release.

tommi@ could you take a look?

Large troubles updating Chromium. Please provide a free Chromium Updater download for all operating systems and platforms.

Did this work before? No

title.$t: Presentation Role should be inherited to required owned elements.

title.$t: Page Info dialog cannot be opened in standalone display mode

content.$t:
When launching an app in standalone display mode on Android, there is no way to open the page info dialog without navigating to the site in the full Chrome app.

This prevents users from allowing permissions which were previously blocked, or vice-versa.

We should provide UI to open the app info dialog from within standalone web apps.

title.$t: :hover class not active when context menu is open

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
https://mdn.mozillademos.org/files/3700/css_dropdown_menu.html

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Hover the mouse over an element with a :hover style. CSS dropdown menus are good examples. Observe the style change.
2. Right click to open the context menu

What is the expected behavior?
The context menu should open and the hover style should remain active

What went wrong?
The context menu opens but the hover style does not remain active.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes About a month ago IIRC

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

If you use the right click menu to inspect an element within a CSS dropdown, because the dropdown closes you will end up inspecting the element behind the menu.

title.$t: Trace viewer's size is big

content.$t: See the link to graphs below.

title.$t: 1% regression in Mac Chromium.app sizes at 322394:322434

content.$t:
This is a ~1MB addition - Intentional?

(Mac sizes perf is in a weird state since a pdf change, and I'm trying to set up a good baseline)

I think this is due to r 322427 -> https://codereview.chromium.org/1038723002 since the bisect with the earlier (reverted) landing had a similar regression.

Reland part 3 of 4: Modify blink users so they use blink images.

Now that the image resources that blink depends on are in the blink
repository, we depend on the blink resources directly, delete the ones
in the chrome tree, and use these resources in the html_viewer.

[This reland also contains a fix to the generate_blink_resource_map.py
file so that its generated code uses unsigned chars, which should
hopefully fix the Win8 gn bot.]

BUG=467176
First Review URL: https://codereview.chromium.org/1033733004

Review URL: https://codereview.chromium.org/1038723002

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#322427}

title.$t: Sessions are not "private" when open two or more private (incognito) windows.

content.$t: Chrome Version : ALL (?) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Mozilla Firefox has the same problem What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Open new private window 2) Enter the URL (example: gmail.com) 3) Login into my email account (example: GMail) 4) Open a new private window 5) Enter the URL (example: gmail.com) What is the expected result? The second private window must be "private" and should not use the sessions/cookies of the first private window. What happens instead? The second private window takes the sessions of the first private window and enter to my account automatically When I open 3, 4, 5 or more private or "incognito" window, Chrome takes the session of the first one.

title.$t: Modifying the prototype for XMLHttpRequest makes it fire continuously in Chrome for iOS

content.$t:
Chrome Version: 41.0.2272.58
Device Type: iPhone 4s, iPhone 5
URLs:
 * http://www.tirrenia.it (full case)
 * http://jsbin.com/zohula/2 (minimal test case, just 3 lines of code)

I intercept AJAX requests in my site by altering the XMLHttpRequest.prototype open and send methods. This method worked without any troubles in all the browsers I tested (Safari, Opera Mini, Mercury, Android Stock Browser and Android Chrome among the others). However, when it comes to Chrome for iOS (iPhone) the code has the weirdest bug: it's like it continuously fire the code I changed in the prototype (ending up crashing, obviously).

As demonstrated in the minimal example code (http://jsbin.com/zohula/2), barely modifying the prototype of XMLHttpRequest makes it fire continuously.

title.$t: chrome.fileSystem files are not instanceof File or Blob

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.104 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create a Chrome App that uses chrome.fileSystem (see attached example).
2. Use chrome.fileSystem.chooseEntry() to get a FileEntry.
3. Call .file() on the FileEntry instance to get a File.
4. Try instanceof File and instanceof Blob on the File instance.

What is the expected behavior?
Both file instanceof File and file instanceof Blob should be true.

What went wrong?
file instanceof File == false and file instanceof Blob == false. The file object looks and behaves like a file (e.g. using FileReader works) but it does not identify as a File or Blob.

Looking the attached output.png, you can see that file.__proto__ and file.__proto__.__proto__ *look* correct when inspected in the debugger, but file.__proto__ == File.prototype is false and file.__proto__.__proto__ == Blob.prototype is false.

Note that both new File([],'').__proto__ == File.prototype and new File([],'').__proto__.__proto__ == Blob.prototype are true. File objects obtained through window.webkitRequestFileSystem also identify properly as File and Blob instances. I'm only having trouble with chrome.fileSystem files.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.104  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

The simple attached Chrome app brings up a file chooser dialog when the button is clicked, then prints out the instanceof tests (showing that they don't work as expected) and the file contents (which shows that the file still works like a File/Blob).

I see the same behavior on stable and 43.0.2350.0 canary on OS X (the only versions I tried).

title.$t: User profiles corrupted after upgrade to Yosemite (crashes entire browser)
