Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Start Chrome canary.
2. I notice it (silently) failed to initialise with my regular user profile and instead is using some fallback without any of my preferences. 
3. Go to People menu with intent to switch.

What is the expected behavior?
Browser initialises with my user profile. And later, menu should open with my two profiles.

What went wrong?
Browser crashes (all tabs).

Crashed report ID: 

How much crashed? Just one tab

Is it a problem with a plugin? N/A 

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 43.0.2350.0  Channel: canary
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: 

Going to the Chrome settings menu I do see my profiles listed but am unable to activate or edit them.

Looking in "Application Support/Chrome Canary" I notice that my Default and Profile 1 directories have not been modified in the last 9 hours (before the upgrade from OSX 10.9 to OSX 10.10 Yosemite). And there is now a new directory "System Profile" that I assume was created upon launch.

Possibly related Crash id. Not sure if it was this one or not.

title.$t: Simplify InputMethodWin initialization

content.$t:
Version: commit hash 00a39f50c2c623987ab68a4ae253147101d21876 / Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#322669}
OS: Windows

This is a reminder of a future clean-up task of InputMethodWin.

As described in the commit message of https://crrev.com/00a39f50c2c623987ab68a4ae253147101d21876, creating a local COM server, ITfInputProcessorProfileMgr in this case, could cause an unexpected message loop reentrance when initializing InputMethodWin.  That's why we introduced a sort of 3 phase initialization for InputMethodWin in that CL.

However, as I commented in https://codereview.chromium.org/1037103004, ITfInputProcessorProfileMgr is unnecessarily initialized in practice.  If we remove the dependency on ITfInputProcessorProfileMgr, then we should investigate if we can revert 00a39f50c2c623987ab68a4ae253147101d21876 with keeping Issue 454375 fixed.

Here are remaining tasks:
1. Fix Issue 296509
2. Change the return value of IMM32Manager::SetInputLanguage from bool to void. Then we don't need to touch any COM object anymore there.
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/5e16d46c92747ae76914b9a5db114a19cdb00bde/ui/base/ime/win/imm32_manager.cc#143
3. Investigate if we can revert 00a39f50c2c623987ab68a4ae253147101d21876 with keeping Issue 454375 fixed.

content.$t: This is branched from https://code.google.com/p/chrome-os-partner/issues/detail?id=38368. WebRTC can send VEA a odd height video to encode -- the most commonly 240x135. We should add a 240x135 test video and modify VEA test to support it.

title.$t: Feature request: Allow tools to remove or resize graphics in print preview

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/43.0.2342.2 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open up a webpage you'd like to print. Here's an example: http://www.economist.com/news/britain/21645247-woeful-approach-language-education-continues-shout-louder
2. Go to the print page (if there is one: http://www.economist.com/node/21645247/print)

What is the expected behavior?
User has the option to remove or resize certain graphics in order to allow text to fit better or reduce wasted space.

Using the example above, here are some issues with the piece:

pic1 shows an issue that occurs on the print page of the article. The picture caption forces the image left, leaving needlessly wasted space. It would be great to have an option that allows the movement of graphics to utilise wasted space. Wrap around text should correct as the graphic is moved so that the space is occupied. Personally, I'd much prefer to remove this graphic from the printout as it is not necessary for the article.

pic2 shows a very large graphic. For an A4-sized printout, this makes it needlessly huge and the graphic is not used to measure the graph but just basically illustrate the matter. There should be an option to resize the graphic to a more reasonable size so more text can fit on the page.

This is just one example. I always stumble across pages that have poorly placed or needlessly large graphics.

What went wrong?
At the moment, this is not possible with the current print preview. I am aware extensions exist for this: I currently use "Print Friendly & PDF", but there are some issues with retaining information, font dimensions, and you can only remove pictures (no resizing option available).

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 43.0.2342.2  Channel: dev
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Page zoom with - wrong mouse coordinate sent to server

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.89 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://electroly.com/chrome-ismap-bug/index.html

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open the URL above.  This page contains an <img> with the "ismap" attribute set, enclosed in an <a> pointing at the same page.  A script on the page prints the query string that Chrome generates when clicking on the image.
2. Set the page zoom level to 100%.
3. Click the red "X" on the page.
4. Observe the coordinates listed underneath the image, which come from the query string that Chrome constructed based on the user's click.  They should be pretty close to the listed coordinates: 123,129.
4. Zoom to 150% and click the X again.  Observe that the coordinates are now slightly lower (around 119,118).
5. Zoom to 200% and click the X again.  Observe that the coordinates have dropped again (around 115, 105).
6. Zoom to 300% and click the X again.  Observe that the coordinates are dropping faster (around 105, 82 now).
7. Zoom to 500% and click the X again.  Observe that the coordinates are way off, with the Y coordinate actually going negative (around 90,-31 now).

What is the expected behavior?
If the user is clicking on the same spot in the image, the coordinates sent to the server in the query string should be the same regardless of the zoom level.  The server doesn't know what the client's zoom level is and expects a coordinate within the image's original dimensions and relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

This works correctly in Firefox 35.0.1 and Internet Explorer 11.0.9600.17280.

What went wrong?
The coordinates sent to the server are increasingly incorrect the greater the zoom level is.  One might expect that it's sending coordinates in the scaled coordinate system (e.g. a click at the lower right corner of a 10x10 image at 200% zoom would be sent as 20,20).  But it seems the opposite is happening.  As the zoom factor increases, the coordinates sent to the server decrease despite the user clicking on the same spot in the image.  Chrome seems to be improperly compensating for the zoom factor when calculating the coordinates to send to the server.

The "smoking gun" is at the 500% zoom level when Chrome calculates a negative number for the Y coordinate--it seems clear that the coordinates should never be negative.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? No Chrome 43.0.2349.2 canary (Windows 64-bit), Safari 7.1 (9537.85.10.17.1)

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.89  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

The HTML5 spec doesn't seem to specify how the coordinates sent to the server for an "ismap" img should be calculated.  My description of the expected behavior is based on how it seems it *must* work in order for server-side image maps to work at all under zooming.  This belief doesn't appear to be explicitly backed up by the HTML5 specification.

title.$t: CryptoToken extension should support the JSON format in the FIDO AppID and Facet Specification

content.$t:
Version: all
OS: all

The CryptoToken extension only implements support for a pre-standard version of the FIDO AppID JSON format, in which the JSON file hosted at the appId URL is a JSON array of origin strings. It should be updated to the agreed-upon specification at http://fidoalliance.org/specs/fido-u2f-v1.0-ps-20141009/fido-appid-and-facets-ps-20141009.html.

title.$t: Touch text cursor position incorrect after overscrolling.

content.$t: Version: 42.0.2311.60 (Official Build) beta (64-bit) OS: ChromeOS What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open convertible chromebook past 180 degrees to activate touchview. 2. Open a google doc or the text app with more than a page of scrollable text. 3. Touch the text to bring up the virtual keyboard. 4. Slowly scroll to the very bottom of the document (engaging overscroll). 5. Scroll back up partway 6. Tap somewhere in the text to try to position the cursor there. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect the cursor to be placed where the text was tapped in #6. Instead, the cursor is placed roughly the keyboard's height lower down in the document. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Feature : Pause Download even if Network Error

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Download a Big file may be near to 1GB
2. When it's 98%, Disconnect the LAN
3. It will show Failed Network Error
4. How frustrating?

(Normally, The internet may disconnect automatically, due to some connectivity issues)

What is the expected behavior?
If its failed, there is now way to resume the download, Instead we have to restart from scratch. If its a normal file, it's not a problem. 

But In case of Large files, its really frustrating. The File I'm downloading is from a site where they don't recommend download managers, cause they steal sensitive data.

I saw there is a paube button. Can't you implement the same automatically, when the internet failed?

What went wrong?
If internet disconnected sudddenly, The inprogress download will be cancelled and shows error "Failed - Network error"
and there is no option to resume when the internet is back.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

Please add this feature, In the time of writing I've got network failure 3 times, and I have to redownload it. My data charges are going up.. Please help.

title.$t: Inconsistent style information (inherit) in "computed" panel

What is the expected behavior?
So, by traversing the node hierarchy upwards, I expect to find an element whose color is either inherited or is defined as that tone of blue

What went wrong?

Its computed color is black, and, according to the information in the computed style panel, is determined by a rule which applies to it because it's a div.

http://caniuse.com/#feat=css-resize

This issue was first raised in this StackOverflow thread
http://stackoverflow.com/q/29306297/1366033

title.$t: JavaScript execution around Blink respects ActiveDOMObject policy

content.$t:
Version: 43.0.2349.0
OS: All

It is meta issue.
In chromium code base there are a lot of javascript execution call for different purpose. The most part of calls ignore current v8 and blink state and ignore ActiveDOMObject policy [1]. It can be dangerous - we have some assertion in blink code and it can change order of js execution.

For solving this problem WebLocalFrame::requestRunTask API was introduced  in [2]. This API allows to wrap current implementation with minimum changes by SuspendableTask and runs this code with respect to ActiveDOMObject policy.

Expected results: all V8 calls around Blink respect ActiveDOMObject policy.

[1] http://www.chromium.org/blink/activedomobject
[2] https://codereview.chromium.org/1009243003/

title.$t: Float clearance calculation for writing-mode: vertical-rl is not correct

content.$t:
Version: 43
OS: All

When a clearing element (in a block formating context with 'writing-mode' set to 'vertical-rl') has a right margin larger than the width of a floated element, then the right margin is collapsed with the margin-left of preceding in-flow sibling.The clearing element is then placed at the point of the resulting collapsed margin.

From CSS test suites:
http://test.csswg.org/harness/test/css-writing-modes-3_dev/single/clearance-calculations-vrl-006/format/html5/

title.$t: ebuilds using cmake are broken

content.$t:
Something is wrong with cmake or with the way portage is invoking it.
Try to emerge the attached ebuild, and you should see in the cmake debug output, between the XXXXXXXXX lines, that the wrong compiler is used during compiler identification, e.g.

 Compiling the C compiler identification source file "CMakeCCompilerId.c" failed.
 Compiler: /usr/bin/cc 

/usr/bin/cc is used instead of something like /usr/bin/armv7a-cros-linux-gnueabi-gcc.

Cmake is invoked with -DCMAKE_USER_MAKE_RULES_OVERRIDE=...gentoo_rules.cmake and that file does set the compiler (or else nothing would compile) but only after the above failure.

I discovered this while working with a CMakeLists.txt that checks ${CMAKE_C_COMPILER_VERSION}.  Cmake died because the variable wasn't set.  (See the ######## line in the test case.)  Packages that don't check variables like that could work despite the bug.  And some chrome os packages do a "tc-export CC" in their ebuild before calling cmake, in which case the given compiler is used in the identification step.  Though this may be against the whole point of CMAKE_USER_MAKE_RULES_OVERRIDE, if that point is to short-circuit cmake's cross-compiling logic.  In any case the tc-export seems to be the most painless workaround.

I looked for a known cmake bug but didn't find one.  Might want to try later versions of cmake too.

title.$t: Severe distortion/corruption in rendering of text in a plain textarea during input

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/43.0.2343.5 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Entering and manipulating text in a simple <textarea>.

I most commonly encounter this when writing comments on GitHub [1] or editing wiki pages using the plain wikitext editor on Wikipedia [2]. However short of some obscure css indirectly causing it, I think it would happen anywhere. These two sites are just the sites I am most likely to find myself using a <textarea> frequent enough to run into this almost every other day.

I've yet to come up with minimal steps to reproduce it but using the below links and typing a few paragraphs overtime. Perhaps switching away to a different tab and back is related, wouldn't be the first type something weird happens to text like losing a font, after some period of time under race conditions.

[1] https://github.com/Krinkle/sandbox/issues/new
[2] https://www.mediawiki.org/w/index.php?title=Project:Sandbox&action=edit

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
After some time (5 minutes?), when adding new characters in the middle of a sentence, they are still rendered in their correct location, but end up overwriting existing to the right of that position. So the existing text is no longer reflowing/rewrapping.

The underlying DOM value is unaffected, this affects the rendering only.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 43.0.2343.5  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: 

Over the past few months almost daily when entering and editing text in a plain textarea with Chrome, strange distortions occur.

It's almost as if at some point it switches over to some kind of hybrid typewriter behaviour where it's typing on top of other letters.

Sometimes it's only a small area in the input field and the text sort of crosses behind a few words still moving/re-wrapping. See attached video capture for an example (towards the end is the most extreme).

01-good: User typed "pa" in front of "matches".
02-bad: User typed "page" in front of "matches". Notice how the "ch" of "matches" has disappeared (squished after "t", behind "es" in "matches").
03-worse": User has types "pages" in front of "matches". Notice how more of "matches" has been squished away, even partial characters are now overlapping ("ms"). And further on the line "ts" of "redirects" got cut off. And on the next line "and I'd like this" became "anais" and "portable became corrupted, too.

I've experienced this at least since Chrome 38 stable on OSX 10.9. And I've seen it regularly on Chrome  41, 42 and now 43 canary. I always attributed it to some graphics thing in OSX, but I figured it's time to report it.

title.$t: Investigate Jank in UIDataTypeController::Associate

content.$t: UIDataTypeController::Associate is janking 3.32 times per hour on M43-CANARY-W

title.$t: Chrome OS Login Reloads Page Unnecessary

content.$t:
If <webview> is navigated to a page via the src attribute, the guest is created.

If the guest redirects, and then attach is called before the src attribute is updated then the guest will navigate again to the previous page.

This is apparent in the Chrome OS Login Page.

title.$t: On Android, allow localhost URLs to be proxied

content.$t: Chrome Version : >= 40 URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Stock android browser on Samsung: OK Firefox (Fennec) 36.0.4: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? - On an Android device, configure a Wifi connection to use a web proxy. - On Chrome >=40 on that Android device, try going to a localhost URL - Observe that the localhost URL is not proxied What is the expected result? The localhost URL is proxied. What happens instead? The localhost URL is not proxied, and an error page is shown. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Chromium developers recently removed the ability to proxy localhost URLs, even if the OS said they should be. (https://crrev.com/80295948bf0bc43ebb640afd81fa152e9679fd36) We'd like that change to be reverted, or at least, the default behavior should be to just follow the Android OS settings for web proxies. Originally, Chromium developers accepted this patch since: - there was a bug in the underlying Android OS that web developers couldn't work around (https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=37031) - and they could not imagine a valid use case for proxying localhost on an Android device. (https://codereview.chromium.org/796003002/) However, - the bug in Android OS seems to be fixed now. On devices running Android 4.4.2, you can add proxy exclusion settings for 'localhost', and the stock Samsung browser and Mozilla Firefox both do the right thing. - our company (Sauce Labs) has a product for developers which *does* need to proxy localhost from Android devices. Sauce Connect opens a tunnel from the developer's desktop machine to a device in our network. This allows them to test URLs like http://localhost:5000/ on the Android device, and the web request will hit the developer's machine. Branden from UAkron suggested a special setting for people who needed localhost proxied, but we think that Chrome on Android should follow the OS settings by default. This would be consistent with what all other browsers are doing, on desktop and mobile. Desktop Chrome already respects a `no_proxy` environment variable (e.g., no_proxy=localhost). If a setting needs to be added for the people still affected by that Android bug, that would be the right pattern to follow. NOTE FOR PEOPLE TRYING TO REPRODUCE THE PROBLEM: One complication is that, when you are setting wifi proxies manually, for some reason, Chrome will still proxy localhost, even though the code says not to do this. So far we are baffled by this. Unfortunately, you can't test this just by manually clicking on the settings in an Android device. However, if you use a program to change that setting (as we do) then Chrome will, as designed, refuse to proxy localhost. We can supply code to do this if you want, but I assumed you wouldn't want to run a random APK here.

title.$t: Fix layering violations in redirect handling.

content.$t:
See comments on https://codereview.chromium.org/1017583002/. The Origin header is part of the Web Platform and takes actions on redirects externally from HTTP. We should clean things up so that:

a) These things happen outside of //net. Probably //content/browser/loader?

b) This is synchronized with the renderer and Blink correctly.

It's quite likely we'll want to split (b) off into yet another bug. I suspect it has a prereq on moving CORS to the browser process or something.

Values can be set via a system property.

title.$t: [No HSP] A2DP is choppy after opening hangouts

content.$t: M42 6812.54.0 samus (WP2) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Stream audio over headset. Audio is normal. 2. Open a hangouts call. Hear sound is distorted, particularly while the call is loading. 3. Leave call open. Hear occasional hitches in streaming audio. 4. Close call. Sound stutters for a moment then continues normally. Saw this behavior with both A2DP-only speakers (808 Hex SL) and A2DP/HSP headsets (including Plantronics Marque 2 M165)

title.$t: Unify OIB security summary phrase calculation across platforms and fix layering violations.

content.$t:
Right now, the security summary phrase strings are duplicated in android_chromium_strings.grd and the calculation in WebsiteSettingsPopup.java tries to duplicate desktop logic: https://docs.google.com/document/d/13TnE2Alg2wiz1TJit7DBuoDcfEl1UCTcrP6EwRcOBaE/edit#heading=h.6p9j0bj57ffz

(At the same time, the desktop string is moving from an identity/cert-only summary to a full page security state summary.)

As a start, we should unify the calculations (of which strings to use) to a single place in C++.
Also see Issue 469853: OIB security summary phrase should reflect the entire security state.

See http://test-results.appspot.com/dashboards/flakiness_dashboard.html#tests=inspector-protocol%2Fdebugger%2Fsuspend-setTimeout-on-pause-in-dedicated-worker.html .

Assigning to yurys, the author of that change, to investigate and triage.

title.$t: Record metrics on how frequently the new tab button is activated with mouse

content.$t:
We currently track the frequency of opening a new tab by:

* Any method (NewTab user action)
* Touching the new tab button (Ash.GestureTarget histogram)
* Ctrl+T accelerator (Accel_NewTab_T)

Add a user action which should fire whenever the new tab button is clicked with mouse.

title.$t: elem.focus() should do a recalcStyle, but not a layout.

content.$t:
We currently force layout on every focus() call.
This can end up leading to layout thrashing.

Poking at it, it doesn't appear to be necessary that the layout is synchronous.

It was added back here: http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/48106/trunk/WebCore/dom/Element.cpp

Do we have to force the synchronous layout?


Internal thread where this was discovered causing 10+ seconds of hang: https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/forum/#!topic/devtools-performance/vzMox1YxQrY

Elliott, I see you were working around here in https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/blink/+/54eeed9cf1751dae1e73f2b6d0d2c5ecd12cf5e2 .. you probably know what's happening?

title.$t: Implement "null canvas" and "painting disabled" perf test modes for Slimming Paint

content.$t:
The rasterize_and_record benchmark includes modes for null canvas and painting disabled.

Null canvas in non-SP means use a Skia canvas that does nothing. Painting disabled means using a graphics context that issues no draw commands.

Null canvas for Slimming Paint probably means something that does no generate any non-empty SkPictures. Painting Disabled for Slimming Paint probably means a mode where we emit no display items at all.

title.$t: Add user actions metrics to track window snapping by a drag

title.$t: OOPIF: Subframe processes not going away after same site main frame navigation

content.$t: Version: 43.0.2347.0 OS: All What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start Chrome with --site-per-process. 2. Visit a page with a cross-site iframe (e.g., http://csreis.github.io/tests/cross-site-iframe.html and click "Go cross-site (simple page)"). 3. Do a same-site main frame navigation (e.g., to http://csreis.github.io/). What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The subframe process should exit. Instead, it's still visible in both Chrome's and the OS's task managers. It looks like we're not getting FrameDetached IPCs for the previous page.

title.$t: Expose host_wrappers to be usable from chromium.gyp_env

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:36.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/36.0

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. modify chromium.gyp_env to use CC.host_wrapper and CXX.host_wrapper.
2. set CC.host_wrapper and CXX.host_wrapper in gyp_env
3. build/gyp_chromium
4. Be sad when the provider wrapper is not used (but notice that CC_wrapper and CXX_wrapper are).

What is the expected behavior?
Expect the wrapper script is used.

What went wrong?
Currently, the gyp variables CC_wrapper and CXX_wrapper can be set in the chromium.gyp_env file. However, the host compiler wrapper variables (CC.host_wrapper, CXX.host_wrapper) cannot. By exposing this variable, in gyp_helper.py, embedders can more easily use tools like ccache or icecream when developing for android.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: <Copy from: 'about:version'>  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 11.2 r202

title.$t: WebView::contentsPreferredMinimumSize() provides incorrect height when zoomed.

content.$t:
Version: 43.0.2347.0 (64-bit)
OS: All

WebView::contentsPreferredMinimumSize() is meant to return the "preferred minimum width of the main document's contents and the minimum height required to display the main document without scrollbars". However, when that content is zoomed to anything other than 100%, the height from this function tends to be incorrect by up to +-3 pixels. In the case when it under-reports the preferred height of the content, this can cause scrollbars to appear when trying to fit some kind of frame or overlay around the content at its preferred size (this happens with extension options).

title.$t: Slimming Paint phase 2 launch

content.$t:
This is a tracking bug for the Phase 2 launch of Slimming Paint.

This launch implements the full architectural changes of Slimming Paint (see go/slimming-paint for design docs). This includes:

1. Compositing decisions in cc
2. Extending the Blink document lifecycle to include painting
3. Sending appropriate information from Blink to cc to represent display list diffs and compositing hints

title.$t: Slimming Paint phase 1 launch

content.$t:
This is a tracking bug for the Phase 1 launch of Slimming Paint.

This launch changes the recording and raster backing of a cc::Layer to be a DisplayItemList, rather than a picture pile of SkPicture objects. Otherwise the architecture is unchanged.

2. Repeatedly move the mouse cursor over the "hover me" text, and see the memory usage

Should not leak memory, nor should use tens of megabytes for these transitions.

What went wrong?
Memory usage is increasing (300MB+), and it's not freed up.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 43.0.2348.0 (Developer Build) (32-bit)  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: 

Removing any of the following properties will fix the problem:
border or color from the ".tip" selector
background-image from the ".tip:hover" selector

Maybe related:
The color of the "placeholder" text doesn't transition (from transparent to black) right after hover, instead it is delayed (however there's no delay set in CSS).

There is a URL constant defined in handler_options_handler.cc that is a duplicate
of a URL defined in url_constants.cc.

title.$t: autotest: shill_xmlrpc_server only logs error messages

content.$t:
shill_xmlrpc_server only logs error messages (i.e. messages logged with logging.error), even though the log level is set to debug:

  if __name__ == '__main__':
      logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG)
  [...]

I changed this value to logging.CRITICAL (defined in src/third_party/edk2/AppPkg/Applications/Python/Python-2.7.2/Lib/logging/__init__.py), but error messages were still logged. This suggests that the logging level set by basicConfig is not used by the logger, or that some other setter is overriding this level.

title.$t: Return more detail on Cast channel establishment failures

content.$t:
With Chrome <41, channel establishment failures would result in relatively verbose error codes that provided some insight about the cause of the failure (even if they were a bit opaque at times).

With Chrome 41+, we get a discrete authentication error, but with no additional data.  This prevents us from distinguishing, say, a transport error from a bad cert from an expired cert.  Having this information permits much better ability to guide users down the right path to resolving the issue.

Talking with Kevin & Haibin, it seemed reasonable to target this for M43.

title.$t: Investigate DOCTYPE synthesis

content.$t:
This report is worrying:
https://www.drupal.org/node/2458013
since it sounds like we may have done something that changes how UIWebView synthesizes missing parts of the DOM when parsing invalid pages.

It sounds like it started in M41, but we should test to make sure it's accurate. (It sounds like a test page that has a doctype and a <head>, but no <html>, may be all we need to reproduce the core issue.)

The most likely thing I can think of would be that injection is affecting this, but I'm not sure why it would have started in M41 given that.

title.$t: Repeated attempts to load failing page create new NavEntries

content.$t:
1. Type a URL that fails to load into the address bar. Hit return.
2. Notice that a new navigation entry is created.

Good.

3. Click in the address bar and tap return to try to reload the same bogus URL.

Result: A new navigation entry is created.

Because it is (essentially) a reload of the page (SAME_PAGE) the new error should replace the existing one. However, the test for replacement in RenderFrameImpl::didFailProvisionalLoad is:

 bool replace =
     navigation_state->request_params().page_id != -1 ||
     ui::PageTransitionCoreTypeIs(transition,
                                  ui::PAGE_TRANSITION_AUTO_SUBFRAME);

The page id in the NavState is -1 when the browser _intends_ to load a new page, not when the renderer _actually_ does so. We need to alter the definition of "replace" here.

In addition, didFailProvisionalLoad notifies the browser, which kills any pending entry. Therefore, if the value of "replace" is changed, NavigationControllerImpl::ClassifyNavigation _misclassifies_ the navigation because a classification of SAME_PAGE requires there to be a pending page. ClassifyNavigation will also need to be fixed.

A test will definitely be needed here.

title.$t: StoragePartitionBrowsingDataRemover should be in components/

content.$t:
StoragePartitionBrowsingDataRemover was introduced in:
https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/1033013003/

WebViewGuest is going to use this for clearing http cache data:
https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/1021073002/

However since SPBDRemover is under chrome/, we cannot use
it from extensions/ and the current plan is to handle this in a
chrome/ delegate from WebViewGuest: ChromeWebViewGuestDelegate.

Once SPBDRemover is moved to components/, the code to use it
can be moved entirely under extensions/.

title.$t: Use of uninitialized memory leads to middle-button scrolling failing

content.$t:
Happens everwhere Freon is used with a keyboard that doesn't have a wheel (e.g. IBM/Lenovo USB keyboard, likely also Stout).

Fix should be one-liner to set the has_wheel value property correctly in the gestures library stuct.

title.$t: Fix "learn more" link on chrome://history - Android

content.$t: Version: M41 OS: Android What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to chrome://history 2. See text: "Showing history from your signed-in devices. Learn More" 3. Learn more points only to help center landing page. It should probably go to the "Sync tabs across devices" article. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Please update the Learn More link to point at: https://support.google.com/chrome/?p=sync_history FYI this was fixed for iOS: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=469773#c7

title.$t: Consider returning an entity count on first time sync such that clients can take action based on massive account sizes

content.$t:
On certain devices, it might not make sense to support syncing accounts of all sizes. Alternatively, it might make sense to take special action/support a limited sync if accounts are too large (i.e. turn off certain datatypes, don't keep certain data in memory, etc.)

For both of these cases though we probably need to have the server return, as part of that first time sync, a set of item counts that can be used as reference before the actual data is downloaded.

title.$t: Tap may show the pins if following long-press

content.$t:
Sometimes a simple tap may show the pins -- if following a long-press that didn't.

1) Enable Contextual Search and tap to establish a selection.
2) Long-press on the selection.  The pins don't show, but probably should (See http://crbug.com/393025).
3) Tap on the selection.  The selection goes away.
4) Tap on the word again.  

Actual: The selection establishes with pins showing!
Expected: The selection establishes without the pins.

title.$t: Use ToT AU generator for all src/tgt images

content.$t:
Since we unpinned AU generator (issue 415763), we use the AU generator from the tgt_image to generator the payloads for tgt_image from any source image.

This is still problematic, because as chromite evolves, it may become API incompatible with tgt_image's AU generator, thereby making it hard to regenerate payloads later (issue 470340).

I've since been told that the idea was to always use ToT AU generator instead.

There might be some landmines here still, so this bug is an RFC to collect possible implications of this switch.
Code changes should be easy.

title.$t: perspective-origin should be positioned in the border box, but is being affected by scrollbars

content.$t: A fix of this should arise naturally from simplifying how we treat perspective.

title.$t: Include perspective in Blink transform trees

content.$t: The transform arising from 'perspective' and 'perspective-origin' should be included in the Blink transform trees.

title.$t: Cancel image requests for invalid resources as soon as possible

content.$t:
Given:

document.createElement('img').src ="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/seductiveapps/largeJSON/master/100mb.json"

Chrome will happily download 100M of data despite not being able to use it.  Firefox, on the other hand, will cancel the request as soon as the decoder sees it can't decode the data, see https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/image/src/imgRequest.cpp?from=imgRequest.cpp&case=true#1046

It would be nice if Chrome did this as well.

title.$t: 'Restrict which users are allowed to sign into Google Chrome' * catch all is ignored.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Import Chrome ADM files into group policy
2. Add *, *@gmail.com, *.*, to the "Restrict which users are allowed to sign in to Google Chrome" policy
3. Refresh group policy on machines. Go to the settings in Chrome and click sign in. Type in just your Google Username with your password and you'll sign in just fine. 

What is the expected behavior?
You should get a message that your sign in has been blocked  by your administrator even if you just use your username. 

What went wrong?
You're still able to sign into Chrome with your Google account even after adding a restriction.

Google's login box will append @gmail.com to your username, the sign in restriction policy does not take this into consideration, even when using * for restricted users.

title.$t: ozone: evdev: fix state restoration on plug & cleanup on unplug

content.$t:
We're not properly resuming contacts that are present when a touchscreen device is initialized.

There's a couple of issues on plug:
  (1) initial pressure and radius are not scaled correctly. Any updates will be correct, though.
  (2) contacts are not dirtied by the initialization process, so we won't dispatch the contact until it changes.

Neither problem is very serious because (a) updates to the parameters are very likely and (b) updates overwrite the erroneous data with correct data. The initial state is short lived.

Anyway, it'd still be better to handle this correctly.

On unplug we're not necessarily releasing touches that are still active. We've been fixing those issues with other devices but it's still buggy for touch.

title.$t: multiple requests when using srcset/sizes on empty cache

content.$t:
Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Close all Tabs
2. Clear Browser Cache
3. Close Browser
4. Open Browser
5. Clear Browser Cache again just to make sure...
6. Request Url

What is the expected behavior?
Just request ONE matching image

What went wrong?
Two images get requested when using <img srcset="..."/>

The first image in the srcset list gets requested first, then the correct matching one. If the first one is larger than the one that should be loaded, only the larger one gets requested. 

This happens in all following cases:
- doesn't depend on src attribute (happens with src and also when src is omitted)
- doesn't depend on sizes attribute (happens with omitted sizes as well as with a single value in sizes e.g. 100vw and also when using media-queries in sizes)

See screenshot for an example.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.96  Channel: stable
OS Version: 4.3/4.4.2/4*?/5.1,5.*?
Flash Version:

title.$t: ChildDiscardableSharedMemoryManager causes crash

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. launch chrome with impl side painting 2. sometimes render process crashes Please use labels and text to provide additional information. SkDiscardableMemory uses ChildDiscardableSharedMemoryManager to allocate discardable memory. ChildDiscardableSharedMemoryManager is used for both blink thread and raster thread in render process. However, ChildDiscardableSharedMemoryManager might not deal with raster thread very well. Here's stack trace. [3740:3743:0327/154451:8265921429:FATAL:weak_ptr.cc(26)] Check failed: sequence_checker_.CalledOnValidSequencedThread(). WeakPtrs must be checked on the same sequenced thread. #0 0x7fe9f0376fee base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() #1 0x7fe9f03a66c9 logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage() #2 0x7fe9f03b451e base::internal::WeakReference::Flag::IsValid() #3 0x7fe9ed3e3411 base::internal::Invoker<>::Run() #4 0x7fe9ed5b824b content::DiscardableSharedMemoryHeap::ScopedMemorySegment::~ScopedMemorySegment() #5 title.$t: Cookie histograms are a bit wacky.

content.$t: It looks like some bugs have crept into the cookie-related histograms.

title.$t: Should expose kDeviceLoginScreenDomainAutoComplete via CrosSettings

content.$t:
Current kDeviceLoginScreenDomainAutoComplete only lives in the PolicyMap - we should expose it through CrosSettings also. peletskyi@: take a look at 
changes to cros_settings\*, owner_settings_service\*, device_settings_provider\*.cc from https://codereview.chromium.org/941713003 as a guide to how to do this.

title.$t: We need a reliable way to get the zoom level of a WebContents.

content.$t:
Version: 43.0.2347.0 (64-bit)
OS: All

Right now, the typical way to get the zoom level of a WebContents is to grab it's ZoomController and then grab the level from there. However, not all WebContents have a ZoomController, so this method does not always work. There should really be a way to get the zoom level of any WebContents in general.

title.$t: Fetching the Manifest should take into account CORS headers

content.$t: The Manifest fetcher is entirely ignoring cross origin requests even when there are some CORS headers allowing them. The Manifest story regarding cross origin isn't entirely clear but after discussions with Marcos Caceres (Mozilla) and Paul Kinlan, I am pretty confident we should allow cross origin Manifest if they are allowed with access controls.

title.$t: Border-raidus and filter: blur makes box-shadow going out of boundary

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://jsfiddle.net/b90hpa40/1/

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Create an element that is applied following css properties:

border-radius: 3px;
box-shadow: rgba(255, 255, 255, 1) 0px 0px 0px 1px;

give the body a dark background-color (like #000) and apply a filter like this on the newly created element:

 filter: blur(2px);
    -webkit-filter: blur(2px);
    -moz-filter: blur(2px);
    -o-filter: blur(2px);
    -ms-filter: blur(2px);

What is the expected behavior?
The content should be blurred and the box-shadow should be in it's designated boundary.

What went wrong?
The content is being blurred, but the box shadow keeps repeading itself and is being displayed as separate boxes, than just to stay in the boundary of it's element.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)

title.$t: Implement a retry mechanism for transient failure on AccountReconcilor

content.$t:
In case of transient failure, AccountReconcilor will simply stop, leaving users in a inconsistent state.

AccountReconcilor should support a retry mechanism (with exponential back-off, to avoid DDoS on GAIA servers).
It should also be possible to query the AccountReconcilor on its current state (success, failure, transient failure, retrying, ...).

mlerman@: Assigning this to you since you are apparently re-factoring AccountReconcilor.

title.$t: Chained CSS3 Animations play incorrectly

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:36.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/36.0

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open the gist found here: http://codepen.io/anon/pen/EaMVrv

   OR..

2. Open the .html file attached named "chainAnimation.html".

NOTE: These gists are both the same and use the same codebase.

What is the expected behavior?
1. When launching the gist a blue square should appear on the left of the screen.

2. The css animation named 'First' should immediately transition the square across the x-axis (from left to right) by 300px for a duration of one second.

3. The animation named 'Second' should begin playing after a delay of one second resulting in the blue square transitioning from right to left (I.e. returns the blue square back to its original starting position).

4. The net result of combining/chaining both animations should entail the blue square transitioning from left to right and then transitioning back to its original starting position.

What went wrong?
1. When the animation named 'Second' begins playing it DOES NOT transition from right to left to return the blue square back to its original starting position. Instead it pauses shortly before returning to its original position WITHOUT smoothly transitioning.

Did this work before? Not Sure. 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.104 (64-bit)  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.6
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

Attached are a couple of screen recordings to help illustrate the issue further.
The attachments are as follows:

1. "CHROME_41.0.2272.104_INCORRECT.mov"
   This movie illustrates the incorrect behavior in Chrome v.41.0.2272.104.
   Notice that at duration 00:00:02 the blue square returns back to its original
   position without smoothly transitioning.

2. "43.0.2346.0_canary_CORRECT.mov"
   This movie illustrates the correct behavior in Chrome Canary v.43.0.2346.0 canary.
   Smooth transition from left to right and back again.

3. Whilst the gist provided DOES use the css animation shorthand 
   syntax (i.e. a comma-separated list of animation definitions) it also occurs
   when written in non-shorthand.

title.$t: Unnecessary 'chrome://downloads/' page is seen

content.$t: Chrome Version : 43.0.2346.0 (Official Build) bb148160238aa54b21001d354556701ea778d96a-refs/heads/master@{#322348} (32/ 64-bit) OS : All (Aero enabled) Precondition: Create 'Supervised user' from 'chrome://settings'. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Launch chrome, go to 'Supervised user' window and navigate to 'http://www.thinkbroadband.com/download.html'. 2) Click on some big files and start download, before completing download close the 'Supervised user window' from 'Close' button. 3) Go to normal window and again click on 'close' button to close the browser, it will display 'Download in progress' popup. 4) Click on 'No' button from 'Download in progress' popup and observe. What happens instead? On clicking 'No' button from 'Download in progress' popup, unnecessary 'chrome://downloads/' page is open in 'Normal window'. What is the expected result? On clicking 'No' button from 'Download in progress' popup, 'chrome://downloads/' page should open in 'Supervised user window' (where actual download is in progress), instead of open in 'Normal window'. (Note: It properly redirect to the "Supervised user 'chrome://downloads'" page, if we close the 'Normal window' from wrench, while 'Supervised user' download is in progress. (Please refer the video.) ) This is a Non-Regression issue, Observed from M-29 from where 'Supervised user' feature has introduced.

title.$t: DevTools doesn't correctly report failed fetch because of cross origin restrictions (with WebURLLoader)

content.$t:
If some code in Chromium is using a ResoureFetcherImpl to fetch some resources using the WebLoaderFrame (aka FRAME_ASSOCIATED_LOADER) and that loader is not allowing cross origins requests, the network request does not even show up in the devtools network tab, making it very hard for web developers to understand what's happening.

Expected result:
* the fetch error is correctly reported.

title.$t: The "range" handling in SVGTextQuery is subtly broken

content.$t:
For ranges like the one passed to SVGTextContentElement.getSubStringLength, the range is resolved to (essentially) visual order. (For RTL runs where it's logical order...)
This may boil down to a spec interpretation issue, but using visual order doesn't seem like the "right thing" to do. (FWIW, Geckos seems to be using logical order fairly consistently AFAICS.)

Implementation-wise I think a change like this would boil down to doing a walk of the logical tree (or probably the LayoutObject-tree) and resolve the range/start-offset. This means an additional tree-walk, but it's a fairly cheap one in this context. (It'd probably also be possible to rewrite the primary walk to be performed this way, which would be slightly more efficient since it can then be done on the fly.)

If you strongly oppose, holler.

Some relevant TCs could look like:

<text direction="rtl">LTR RTL</text>
<text direction="rtl">LTR <tspan>RTL</tspan></text>

title.$t: [DevTools] Remove support for old /json/new

content.$t:
JSON request for new tab that only opened about:blank existed for three releases more than a year ago (M29-M31) and then was improved (see crbug.com/311014) to include URL. However, old version is still supported.

This is used only with Chrome of only those versions and should be dropped.

title.$t: wikipedia: wrong representation of text selection

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. open wikipedia or the test content attached
2. select the text which is below the box and extend one handle to end of the textbox
3. And drag the other handler towards the inputbox. We can see both selection handlers inside text box but along with the text which is inside input box the text which is part of the webpage is also getting selected

What is the expected behavior?
usually when selection is inside input box text and both the handlers are inside input box, rest of the webpage content should not get selected

What went wrong?
though start and end handlers are inside input box, text which is below the input box is considered in selection range

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 
Flash Version: 

Nope

title.$t: Consider whether we can implement screen orientation lock in WebView

content.$t: WebView doesn't currently support screen orientation locking because WebView doesn't control the Activity in which it's embedded and thus can't trivially prevent the orientation from changing. We should look into whether this is possible to actually implement this (perhaps by just asking the embedding app to do it).

title.$t: ObjectProxy should cancel outgoing method calls when destroyed

content.$t:
ObjectProxy's current implementation does nothing when destroyed.
This has caused no problem because we haven't used Bus::RemoveObjectProxy() for any active ObjectProxy.

However, according to kaliamoorthi@, it's unavoidable to call RemoveObjectProxy() for an ObjectProxy which may have outgoing method calls, and it results in a crash with the current implementation.
(I'm not familiar with the details as there is little information about the problem in issue 470514.)

No matter how issue 470514 gets resolved, I think it's nice to add proper handling of outgoing method calls to ObjectProxy's dtor.
In dbus-glib, when an object proxy is disposed, all outgoing method calls belonging to the proxy are cancelled.
(http://cgit.freedesktop.org/dbus/dbus-glib/tree/dbus/dbus-gproxy.c#n1540)
I think we should do the same thing in our dbus::ObjectProxy.

title.$t: v8::Object::Clone() crashes

content.$t:
The v8::Object::Clone() API supposedly can copy all kinds of Objects. In fact, in can only copy stuff that has a map of type js array or js object.

This causes crashes on M42.

We should update the documentation of Clone() and lift the restriction. Basically, the method should check that if the object is linked to a function template info, the cloned version is not.

Should probably also return a Maybe<> and just throw if we can't clone

title.$t: ARC: valgrind does not know the existence of runnable-ld.so

content.$t:
This makes valgrind's error message less readable and writing suppression.txt harder.

Valgrind thinks files mapped by mmap(PROT_READ|PROT_EXEC) are shared objects, thus it tries to read debug info of them. However, nonsfi_loader uses mmap(PROT_READ)+mprotect(PROT_READ|PROT_EXEC) so valgrind does not realize there are new shared objects.

I've added a work-around for shared objects loaded by the Bionic loader. It uses direct mmap syscall to load shared objects. Note this hack is only for valgrind+nonsfi_loader. This must not be in the production binary, seccomp-bpf will kill you when mmap(PROT_READ|PROT_EXEC) is called.

However, we can do nothing for mmap called by nonsfi_loader which is used to mmap runnable-ld.so. There could be two solutions:

- Invent an ARC side hack. Not sure, but maybe we could call mmap(PROT_READ|PROT_WRITE) to regions the Bionic loader is already mapped and valgrind notices the existence of it.
- Add a runtime flag to nonsfi_loader to enable PROT_READ|PROT_EXEC.

title.$t: Get rid of separate TextField and TextArea AX roles, add multiline attribute

content.$t:
Right now we're using the TextField role for single-line and TextArea for multi-line, but that breaks SearchBox, which can be either.

Instead, we should have a single TextBox role, and a separate multiline attribute.

title.$t: Enable LLVM LTO on Mac

content.$t: This is a tracking bug for enabling LLVM LTO on Mac. This may provide performance and binary size benefits, as well as being a prerequisite for issue 469377.

title.$t: ARC: gdb integration does not work for remote when direct network connection is not available

content.$t:
Current gdb integration requires direct IP connection.
I have a complicated network configuration that uses ssh.
It would be nice if ssh connection set up is sufficient and required ports are forwarded along with it.

title.$t: ARC: launch_chrome --jdb-type=emacsclient does not work on remote.

content.$t: Currently it tries to run emacsclient on chromebook and cannot find emacsclient command.

title.$t: Roboto kerns forward slashes poorly in omnibox

content.$t: The kerning on forward slashes when using Roboto in the omnibox on low-DPI displays looks bad to me. There's too much space to the right of the slashes vs. to the left. Noto Sans doesn't have this problem.

title.$t: [MD]Lots of keys do not have touch feedback

content.$t: Chrome Version: 6.5.1.5 Chrome OS Version: Version 43.0.2345.0 canary 64-bit Chrome OS Platform: 6916.0.0 Firmware Google_Clapper 5216.199.7 Steps To Reproduce: 1. Switch to full layout vk. 2. Click on Ctrl(or alt) key. Expected Result: Ctrl(or alt) key should be highlighted, like caps lock key. Actual Result: They're not highlighted.

title.$t: Clear browsing data dialog banner has wrong key combination for Incognito on Mac

content.$t: Version: 43.0.2346.0 (Official Build) canary (64-bit) OS: 10.9.5 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open chrome://settings/clearBrowserData What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The yellow banner says "Psst! Incognito mode (Ctrl+Shift+N) may come in handy next time." On Mac, this should be Command+Shift+N.

title.$t: smart lock: ability to re-lock device from Android notification

content.$t: Description: Smart lock: Ability to re-lock device from smartphone/wear notification Use case: When a device is unlocked, it's possible that I am within bluetooth range, but not physically at my machine (i.e. I didn't perform the unlock). I should be able to NACK the unlock from the smartphone/wear notification in case it's not me who unlocked the device. Motivation: There is little value in an un-actionable notification that a device was unlocked. While I usually have line of sight to my device when in bluetooth range, this isn't always the case. It's possible for someone to impersonate me and log into the device, and I have no ability to revoke that access grant. Existing workarounds: Run back to desk before my coworkers start playing pranks on me with my machine.

title.$t: WebRtcBrowserTest.RunsAudioVideoWebRTCCallInTwoTabs failing on WK Canaries

content.$t:
WebRtcBrowserTest.RunsAudioVideoWebRTCCallInTwoTabs is consistently timing out on the WK Canary bots:

http://test-results.appspot.com/dashboards/flakiness_dashboard.html#testType=browser_tests&tests=WebRtcBrowserTest.RunsAudioVideoWebRTCCallInTwoTabs

The timeout is happening waiting for the JS "createLocalOffer" call to complete.

It's not clear why this started happening.  The test looks to have been flaky for some time, but the consistent failures seemed to start happening around this range or so:

http://build.chromium.org/f/chromium/perf/dashboard/ui/changelog_blink.html?url=%2Ftrunk&range=192615%3A192621&mode=html

The most obvious change in that timeframe is https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink?view=rev&revision=192621 , but I'm not sure that's actually the culprit.

In the meantime, this is blocking the Blink autoroll bot, so I'm going to disable the test.  I hope you guys can triage this failure better than I can.

title.$t: Fix video_*/control.* NAMEs
ARC: ndk_translation: CHAR_MAX differs between NaCl x86_64 host and guest.

content.$t:
Not sure whether it can cause real issues or not, but for record.

The following test in bionic cts tests is failing.

https://android.googlesource.com/platform/bionic/+/7e0d0f8572152c47a993e7bc8407690556754bd4/tests/locale_test.cpp
TEST(locale, localeconv) {
  ...
  EXPECT_EQ(CHAR_MAX, localeconv()->int_frac_digits);
  ...
}

On ARC gcc char is unsigned and thus CHAR_MAX = 0xff, which is the expectation.
On Intel char is signed and thus simple trampoline reusing localeconv() impl in the NaCl-x86_64 build bionic returns 0x7f actually.

For this particular case we can probably just wrap localeconv(), but there may be other instances.

title.$t: [a11y] VoiceOver's Web Rotor feature no longer works on web pages

content.$t: Chrome Version : 41.0.2272.104 (Official Build) URLs (if applicable) : any OS version : 10.10.2 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Behavior in Chrome for Windows: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch VoiceOver screen reader with CMD+F5, open Chrome and load bbc.co.uk website as an example. 2. Focus inside the page by pressing the TAB key. 3. Press CTRL+OPT+U to open the Web Rotor feature. What is the expected result? VoiceOver should execute the command and open the list of elements on the web page, i.e. links, headings, form fields, etc. What happens instead? VoiceOver fails to open the Web Rotor. Notes: try the steps above but this time with Safari. Notice how pressing CTRL+OPT+U opens the Web Rotor and displays the list of elements on the page.

title.$t: some views in system tray doesn't update its font when locale has changed at login

content.$t: Google Chrome 43.0.2345.0 (Official Build) canary Platform 6916.0.0 (Official BUild) canary-channel peppy What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. create the owner account with English UI 2. create another account with Japanese UI 3. confirm login screen is in English (since that's owner language) 4. login to the Japanese account 5. open the system tray What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Japanese text uses a different font when English UI is used (see issue 471094). For the 'logout' button and the IME mode indicator in the status tray area uses this font, while every other UI uses the correct Japanese font. I guess some views are created in the login screen, and it doesn't update the font-list when locale has changed. FYI for the attached screenshot (it's not clear unless you're familiar with Japanese though...) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Invert progress center arrows

content.$t:
The caret arrows in the progress center are upside down -- when closed, it  should point up. When open, it should point down. 

Also, is it possible to animate the transition between up and down? So that when you click the caret, it spins 180 to point down/up?

title.$t: Fix failing printing tests in Slimming Paint

content.$t: Numerous printing related layout tests fail in Slimming Paint mode, probably due to the way printing paints to a chrome provided canvas, not the compositor. We could also be super efficient. IIRC we paint once for each page right now, where we could generate one display list and play it back for each page.

title.$t: [Freon] Mouse pointer is missing after switching between VT2 to VT1.

content.$t: Version: 6915.0.0 OS: Chrome What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Sign in to the device. 2. Close all open windows. 3. Switch to VT2 (Ctrl + Alt + F2) 4. Switch to VT1 (Ctrl + Alt + F2) 5. Try to use trackpad. What is the expected output? Mouse pointer should work with trackpad. What do you see instead? Mouse pointer is missing. Need to use keyboard to get back the mouse pointer. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Opening progress center while syncing is a weird transition.

Move it such that the title bar is pushing against the top of the monitor. 3. This should make the window end up snapping to one side of the new monitor. 4. Fullscreen the youtube video. title.$t: After logging in only chrome://extensions is loaded

content.$t:
It seems that every single time I log into my Chrome Pixel with my personal account, it starts up with only one tab: chrome://extensions.

I know by now that if I press Ctrl+Shift+T I get a window with all the tabs that were open when I shut down the machine. But, I doubt many people know this trick.

Note: The tab it shows me at startup (chrome://extensions) is _not_ a tab that was open when I shut down the machine. It just happens to be the tab it chooses to show me after I log in.

title.$t: Code review tool: publish comments dialog button can be improved

content.$t:
Right now it has these buttons:
 * Send
 * Send & CQ
 * Cancel

If you are the code author, these probably make sense. But if you are the reviewer, it would be better to have:
 * Send
 * Send & LGTM
 * Send & LGTM+CQ
 * Cancel

In particular, Send & CQ doesn't make that much sense since you always want LGTM with it if you are reviewer.

title.$t: Add support for Firewire Video Capture.

content.$t:
There's a bunch of Firewire cameras out there [1]. 

In Linux systems, libdc1394 can be used to capture video
as in example [2].

In Windows, they can be accessed using DirectShow.
(We might need to double check that they actually _do_
work with the current code).

New Mac systems don't have FireWire ports anymore.

[1] http://damien.douxchamps.net/ieee1394/cameras/
[2] http://www.tldp.org/HOWTO/html_single/libdc1394-HOWTO/#example

title.$t: StyleResolver reconstruction causes unnecessary re-layout on subsequent style changes

content.$t:
When the StyleResolver is reconstructed, we re-add font faces to the FontFaceCache even when none were really removed/added. That causes the version number of the FontFaceCache to increase which will subsequently cause a re-layout for every LayoutObject that gets its LayoutStyle recalculated as long as it has a FontFallbackList.

For an analyzed stylesheet update, just removing an empty stylesheet from a document with @font-face rules will cause a Reconstruct that will lead to such unnecessary re-layouts.

See attached demo.

title.$t: monitor configuration changes between Release/TakeDisplayOwnership crashes Chromium

content.$t: As per https://github.com/dnschneid/crouton/issues/1487 If the monitor configuration is touched between dbus calls to ReleaseDisplayOwnership and TakeDisplayOwnership, Freon appears to get confused and crash. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Freon should re-establish the config it wants and continue living.

title.$t: AX tree contains some nodes that are incorrectly marked as editable

content.$t:
isReadOnly() should be true unless the node is contenteditable or part of a text field.

This manifests on Windows when you open a menu list (<select>) and NVDA announces "editable".

content.$t:
When syncing wallet cards, we can locally save the number. There is a checkbox to control this.

Due to some questions about the checkbox, we want a field trial to control whether to display the checkbox.

title.$t: Pressing Tab + Enter while in fullscreen opens chrome://downloads

content.$t: Chrome Version : 41.0.2272.77 OS Version: Linux What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open about:blank 2. Go fullscreen (e.g. by pressing F11). 3. Focus the page (e.g. by clicking inside it). 4. Press Tab (to move the focus from the page to the chrome), followed by Enter. What is the expected result? Nothing should happen. What happens instead of that? chrome://downloads is opened.

title.$t: URLFetcher tests are crazy

content.$t:
url_fetcher_impl_unittests has about 20 different test fixtures.  Most just have a different CreateFetcher and OnURLFetchComplete methods.  The fixtures are defined at the top of the file, and tests are all at the bottom.  Many fixtures are only used for one or two tests.  This makes reading through the tests painful.

It's much simpler to just use one test fixture and inline the (fairly minor) differences in the individual tests.

title.$t: Implement UI between bootstrapping success and user session starts

content.$t: After bootstrapping UI, we show a spinner before user session starts. Chromebook is triing to talk to user's phone at that time. We might want show additional message and offer retry in case of error.

title.$t: Several antialiased text-rendering tests failing on Mac 10.6

content.$t:
The following tests are all failing on the Mac 10.6 bots:

virtual/antialiasedtext/fast/text/apply-start-width-after-skipped-text.html
virtual/antialiasedtext/fast/text/bidi-explicit-embedding-past-end.html
virtual/antialiasedtext/fast/text/emphasis-overlap.html
virtual/antialiasedtext/fast/text/fake-italic.html

The likely cause of these failures is https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/blink?view=rev&revision=192506 .  The new behavior is significantly different from the old, with noticeable font size/layout changes.

Emil took a look at the new behavior, here were his comments:

virtual/antialiasedtext/fast/text/bidi-explicit-embedding-past-end.html is wrong for sure (or all other platforms are wrong)
virtual/antialiasedtext/fast/text/emphasis-overlap.html matches the other platforms better so I'd say it is ok
virtual/antialiasedtext/fast/text/apply-start-width-after-skipped-text.html is equally broken before and after the change
Could you mark the four tests as incorrect and file a bug?

This is that bug :).

This test also marked a variety of other font-related tests as needing a rebaseline.  It's possible some of these are also in need of fixing.  I don't know whether reverting the original CL here is correct.  Leaving this in Emil's hands; I will mark the four tests here as expected failures.

title.$t: blaze battery appears not to charge

content.$t:
Josafat's system was handed to me today with the report that it does not charge its battery.

The symptom persists.  It does not charge, and the system operates only when plugged.  When I boot, the battery icon briefly appears, then it gets removed.
The battery appears physically connected.
When I remove the battery and plug in power to boot, the battery icon no longer appears even briefly.
When I reattach the battery and plug in power to boot, the battery icon again appears briefly on boot.

So it looks like the battery is plugged.  One other system reportedly had a loose battery cable.  A third is still in transit.

I have to lift a copper plate to see if the servo header is attached.  That will give access to the EC uart to talk to the battery.

title.$t: metadata processing in payload_generation isn't very useful

content.$t:
The payload_generator/metadata.{h,cc} module iterates over the metadata blocks of the fs and produces a delta operation between the two... but when iterating the inodes, it basically checks for inodes with the same inode number in old and new fs that haven't change...

Looking at a recent stable channel delta ( for example chromeos_6158.70.0-6680.78.0_daisy_stable-channel_delta_snow-mp-v3.bin-fd3096818adefa6b56a0418a4a71e6d9.signed.log ) we see that there only 3 inode operations <rootfs-inode-%d-metadata>, one for the inode 2 (root inode) and one for the inode 11 (/lost+found)... after that, it never helps... and all that data goes to the REPLACE_BZ in <rootfs-non-file-data> which should be mostly the empty space but in this example has 300KB of compressed data.

title.$t: webstore onetime paid app install Failed - Server problem

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Be signed into the webstore with multiple accounts (work account email managed by google apps) and personal
2. Buy the app and credit card is successfully charged
3. Installation fails with a message in the popup downloads bar "Failed - Server problem"

What is the expected behavior?
The paid app should install after the card is successfully charged

What went wrong?
The app does not install, the downloading of the CRX results in an error with the message to the user "Failed - Server problem"

WebStore page: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/jstorrent/anhdpjpojoipgpmfanmedjghaligalgb

Did this work before? Yes Users started reporting the problem around Jan 17, 2015

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

I have been unable to reproduce the issue myself, perhaps because I don't have a google apps for business account to reproduce the issue.
However, I get around 10 reports a week consistently for the past couple of months.
I originally thought it was due to a delay in processing the payment, but now that I have determined every user who has the problem logs out all their accounts and logs in with the single personal account, it is able to download and install the CRX file.

I notice that the web store seems to handle everything correctly when having multiple local profiles as well as multiple accounts under a single profile, as long as these are all personal accounts (at least I am unable to reproduce the issue)

You can see the history of users reports of the errors at https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/jstorrent/anhdpjpojoipgpmfanmedjghaligalgb/support

title.$t: toolchain: move LIBC_VERSION out of make.conf.board_setup

content.$t:
LIBC_VERSION is a variable containing the version of libc installed in a given sysroot.

It is used by install_toolchain to detect a stale glibc and 

Currently, we store libc's version in make.conf.board_setup even though it is not really a sysroot specific config.
This means that, when regenerating the configuration, we have to manually save it and reset it.

We could move it in ${SYSROOT}/build/cache/LIBC_VERSION which would be managed by install_toolchain uniquely and would remove the need to persist it.

AFAIK, it is only used by install_toolchain and src/scripts/build_library/base_image_util.sh.

title.$t: w3c import script does not handle CDATA well in .xht references

content.$t:
The CSSWG tests have a few XHTML files with CDATA sections in their reference files. It looks like the script takes them as it is, but renames them to -expected.html. This doesn't work as the CDATA section is invalid in HTML.

Either the script should strip the CDATA, or leave the expected file as .xht (if the testrunner supports that?)

Examples:
css-flexbox-1/ref-filled-green-100px-square.xht:  <style type="text/css"><![CDATA[
css-flexbox-1/reference/ref-filled-green-100px-square.xht:  <style type="text/css"><![CDATA[

Oddly, it looks like the script kept css-flexbox-1/flex-grow-001-ref.xht as an xht file??

title.$t: Passing -0 as an integer argument for extension API functions will crash the extension

content.$t: Version: ToT OS: All What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Find extension API function with integer argument (e.g. chrome.windows.get()) 2. Call function with -0 value. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The app is terminated by the extension system. I see the following logs: [32740:32740:0325/182652:ERROR:extension_function.cc(400)] Bad extension message metricsPrivate.recordSparseValue [32740:32740:0325/182652:ERROR:extension_function_dispatcher.cc(112)] Terminating renderer because of malformed extension message. [32740:32740:0325/182652:ERROR:extension_function_dispatcher.cc(89)] NOTREACHED() hit in KillBadMessageSender. This behaviour has bitten us in bug 470752. We implemented a workaround in the app, but I feel extension APIs should probably treat -0 values more sanely. At the very least, the extension shouldn't just crash. In JavaScript, -0 === 0, so this bug can be triggered very opaquely. For example, I ran into this bug by using the result of Math.round(). Perhaps the extension system should special case -0, and parse it to an int32 zero.

title.$t: Disable URL protocol schemes to block local file viewing in Chrome missing, URLBlacklist doesn't block local file system unless drive letter is explicitly stated.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open Group Policy
2. Import latest Chrome ADM files
3. Add C:/ or file to the URLBlacklist policy. Refresh group policy
4: Type in C:/ and it won't be blocked.

What is the expected behavior?
Disable URL protocol schemes was used to block local file system access. It's now deprecated and is suggested to use URLBlacklist. The URLBlackList policy doesn't accept 'file' as a catch all like the Disable URL protocol scheme did.

How can we block all local file system access in Chrome now, like we used to be able to with the URL protocol scheme using 'file'?

What went wrong?
Disable URL protocol schemes has been removed and replaced with URLBlacklist(?) and URLBlacklist doesn't block C:/ unless C:/ is explicitly stated as a URL. 

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: 

See - https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=106166

title.$t: /sys/devices/virtual/chromeos/cros_ec has vanished

content.$t: Kernel: 3.14.0 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Follow the instructions posted here: http://goo.gl/Cknuxk 2. Be disappointed What is the expected output? What do you see instead? When the Pixel (2013) launched, I published instructions for poking at the lightbar from userspace. At least one person has written an application to do just that (https://plus.google.com/+FrancoisBeaufort/posts/jVTeB13v9ze), but it no longer works. The idea behind putting cros_ec under /sys/devices/virtual/chromeos was that it would be nice to have a single location to look for EC controls regardless of how the EC was connected. Even if we can't come up with a good place for cros_ec, cros_pd, etc., can we at least put the lightbar part somewhere where it can be easily found? Maybe under /sys/class/leds/ if nothing else? Thanks.

title.$t: Erase Sync DB when corruption is detected during SaveChanges

content.$t:
The Sync DB is a sqlite database that backs the sync Directory.

Sync takes care to detect database corruption on load (OnDiskDirectoryBackingStore::TryLoad), however, if corruption is detected as part of SaveChanges(), there doesn't appear to be a mechanism for destroying the corrupted database.

In these cases, it's not clear that the corruption will be reliably detected in TryLoad upon restart.

We may want to leverage Connection::set_error_callback and invoke some type of error handler that stops sync, closes the db, and then deletes it.

This is related to Google-internal bug b/19837129.

Here's an example error message logged during SaveChanges:

ERROR:connection.cc(1060)] SyncDirectory sqlite error 11, errno 0: database disk image is malformed, sql: INSERT OR REPLACE INTO metas ( metahandle, base_version, server_version, local_external_id, transaction_version, mtime, server_mtime, ctime, server_ctime, id, parent_id, server_parent_id, is_unsynced, is_unapplied_update, is_del, is_dir, server_is_dir, server_is_del, non_unique_name, server_non_unique_name, unique_server_tag, unique_client_tag, unique_bookmark_tag, specifics, server_specifics, base_server_specifics, server_unique_position, unique_position, attachment_metadata, server_attachment_metadata )  VALUES ( ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ? )

title.$t: Review ProfileHelper::GetSigninprofile usage for webview based

content.$t:
We need to go over the GetSigninprofile() in /login/* code to see if it needs to be updated for webvew based sign-in.

Here are a few places that might need to be updated:

auth_prewarmer.cc:
Using background URL fetch to initiate ssl handshake etc earlier. We need to check if webview's URL request context needs this as well.

chrome_login_performer.cc:
Create and start WildcardLoginChecker using sign-in profile. Seem we should to use something else (webview based sign-is has no cookies, so we might need to pass down a RT or AT here)
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/chrome/browser/chromeos/login/auth/chrome_login_performer.cc&l=103

Also need to check the GetSigninContext and GetSigninRequestContext usage.

title.$t: FAFT should only query ecfw_act if the DUT has an EC

content.$t:
The chromeos_interface in FAFT queries, among other things, the active EC firmware (ecfw_act). However, Chromebox/base devices don't have ECs so it doesn't really make sense to query it on those devices.

We work around this on x86 by hard-coding the value to ACTIVE_ECFW_RO in the ACPI tables. Non-x86 devices don't have this hack and are failing certain tests in FAFT because of it (chrome-os-partner:38353).

We should probably add a "has_ec" variable in FAFT so that EC-specific data isn't queried on systems without an EC. There is an existing "chrome_ec" variable, but I don't think we can use that for this purpose since we have Chromebooks with a non-ChromeOS EC that report this value (stout, parrot, lumpy, etc).

title.$t: ErrorScreen::OnDiagnoseButtonClicked should use app profile instead of sign-in profile

content.$t:
OnDiagnoseButtonClicked is invoked when user clicks on "Diagnose" button on the error screen during kiosk app launch. The button is supposed to bring CCD app in the app's profile to do network check.

https://codereview.chromium.org/872633008 changes it to use sign-in profile during refactoring. We should go back to ProfileManager::GetActiveUserProfile() (or anything that gives us the app profile of the running kiosk app) as before.

title.$t: Broken caret movement in contenteditable with -webkit-column-count:2

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.89 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. open the attached file
2. place caret towards the end of the first column
3. use the right arrow to move the caret to the end of the first column and over to the beginnnig of the next column

What is the expected behavior?
I expect the caret to go to the end of the last line in the first column then jump to the beginning of the next column and keep moving if the arrow key continues to be pressed.

What went wrong?
I've never seen this work as expected in Chromium, but the exact behavior seems to depend on a number of things. I have seen the following behaviors:
- caret goes to the next column then gets "stuck", or disappears, or jumps somewhere else in the column.
- caret moves below the first column and appears to move along an imaginary line, then jumps to the second line of next column.
- caret just vanishes.

You can trigger some of these behaviors by modifying the file I attached to remove the padding of the second div, and/or by removing the second DIV and putting the -webkit-column-count in the DIV that has contenteditable attribute.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.89  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.8.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0
