title.$t: Firing order for mouseenter/mouseleave is wrong in two ways

content.$t:
Our firing order is bad in two ways, test using http://jsbin.com/qefito/quiet:

#1. mouseenter/mouseleave should follow mouseover/mouseout: Move the mouse from white (outside) to yellow, then back to white again.
Expected event order: mouseover mouseenter mouseout mouseleave
Actual event order: mouseenter mouseover mouseleave mouseout

#2. mouseenters should follow parent-to-child ordering: Move the mouse from white directly into dark-green (using bottom edges or even another overlapping window).
Expected event order: mouseenter received by yellow then light-green then dark-green.
Actual event order: mouseenter received by dark-green then light-green then yellow.

The expected way is defined in the spec:
http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/#events-mouseevent-event-order ,
and all of Firefox, IE and Safari follow the spec.

title.$t: sourcemaps for inline javascript are incorrect by an offset

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.89 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Transpile a JS file (e.g. 6to5) using inline sourcemaps (it may also fail for out-of-line sourcemaps, but I didn't try). The JS file should include an unreferenced behavior. For example:
console.log('hi')
aaaaaa
2. script src the transpiled file and show in browser
3. Open devtools. You should see an error, and the error should link to the correct line in the *source* of the transpiling. This is the expected behavior
4. Now copy the transpiled JS file into a <script> tag in the HTML itself (including the //# sourceMap thingie)
5. Re-fresh the browser and open devtools
6. You will see the same error, but it will show it in the source from an offset. The offset is dependent on the location of the <script> tag in the HTML.

Note - the JS file should be a long one, e.g.
console.log('hi')
aaaaaa
console.log('hi')
console.log('hi')
console.log('hi')
console.log('hi')
console.log('hi')
console.log('hi')
console.log('hi')
//... more

This is because the offset may be larger than the length of the script, in which case Chrome will show the error as the last line.
The attached zip contains the same transpiled file - once inlined and once script-src, where you can verify this behavior
FYI, The transpilations were created via babeljs using: babel --source-maps-inline checkmap.js

What is the expected behavior?
The same behavior should be true whether the file is script src-ed or not.

What went wrong?
The mapping between source line and transpiled line was off by an offset in the case of the inline script

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.89  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: spurious ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED from Cronet

content.$t:
Version: ToT
OS: Android

When NetworkChangeNotifierAndroid is created it spawns a new thread upon which it creates a DnsConfigServicePosix, which in turn kicks off a read of the hosts file.  When this read finishes we send a NetworkChangeNotifier DNSChanged signal which can cause requests to fail with ERR_NETWORK_CHANGED.

I'm guessing this doesn't cause any problems for Chrome because the NetworkChangeNotifier is created very very early on.  In Cronet the NetworkChangeNotifier is created very late, especially in apps with bogged down UI threads (as the NetworkChangeNotifier is created by a task posted to the UI thread).  The read of the hosts file completes almost instantly, at which point in Chrome's initialization there likely haven't been any network requests issued.  In Cronet's case, there is likely to be a pile of network requests queued for dispatch immediately after the NetworkChangeNotifier is created.

title.$t: links (menu) dont werk anymore when a PDF is opened and closed in a new tab

What went wrong?

It's a simple list:
<ul>
   <li class="desktopFirst"><a class="active" href="/movement/">Movement</a></li>
   <li class="last"><a href="/product/">Product</a></li>
   <li class="mobileFirst"><a href="/">Overview</a></li>
</ul>

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes before 41.0.2272.56

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.56  Channel: stable
OS Version: 1
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

OP (Dutch): https://productforums.google.com/d/topic/chrome-nl/6EOdkONfTrU/discussion

Only on iOS.

We've tried a lot to solve it, but could not figure out what went wrong.

title.$t: Clean up legacy code after migration to the new GAIA flow

content.$t:
Much legacy code will left after we migrate to the new <webview>-based authentication. Let's track work items in this issue.

Items to start with: 
* "oobe_screen_oauth_enrollment_webview.*" files should be renamed to 
"oobe_screen_ernollment.*"
* "oobe_screen_oauth_enrollment.*" files should be removed.

title.$t: Auto-scroll ignores CSS transformations on focus in iframes

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/600.4.10 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/8.0.4 Safari/600.4.10

Example URL:
http://codepen.io/cvn/pen/KwVePP

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open URL above
2. Resize your browser window so you can't see the pink lines
3. Press tab a few times to cycle focus through the inputs
4. The document will scroll to show elements that overflow the viewport
5. Tick the "scale" checkbox
6. Press tab a few more times

What is the expected behavior?
The document should not scroll when focusing on an input inside the iframe since the entire iframe is already visible

What went wrong?
The document scrolls to show the focused elements as if they were not scaled.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? No 

Does this work in other browsers? No Safari 8

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.104  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: n/a

* This only happens when there are elements that cause overflow.
* The position of the focused elements appears to always be calculated from the top left of the iframe.
* The document scrolls even if it is overflow:hidden;
* Firefox 36 handles this correctly, and does not scroll unnecessarily.

title.$t: Remove duplication in mini_installer.gyp/.gypi

content.$t: r111710 introduced src/chrome/mini_installer.gypi, which duplicates much of src/chrome/mini_installer.gyp. This duplication has all of the obvious drawbacks. Please kill off one of the two. Thanks.

if:

title.$t: overlord: add shopfloor_urls to the list of possible overlord servers

content.$t: Overlord server is usually running on the same server as the shopfloor server. ghost should be aware of the changes of the shopfloor_url in the test list, and reconnect to the correct server.

title.$t: overlord: update machine ID to mlb_number once it's set

content.$t: When mlb_number is set for the device in the factory test, ghost should automatically update the machine ID to MLB number and reconnects with overlord.

title.$t: Add UMA statistics on how many password form with 2 fields

content.$t: In order to allow Autofill server processing of password forms with only 2 fields we have to understand what will be increasing of number of queries to Autofill server. Adding UMA statistics will help to estimate this.

title.$t: ShellApiTest.Basic is flaky on Linux Tests (dbg)(1)(32)

content.$t:
Sample build: http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.linux/builders/Linux%20Tests%20%28dbg%29%281%29%2832%29/builds/11582

Probably caused by patches from this build or one of the previous ones. Test flakes, so there is no particular build to blame. 
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.linux/builders/Linux%20Tests%20%28dbg%29%281%29%2832%29/builds/11434

Over to yoz@ for triage.

title.$t: Microsoft GS Wavetable Synth unavailable on Windows 8.1 (Web MIDI API problem)

content.$t: Chrome Version : 41.0.2272.101 m with Web MIDI API flag enabled URLs (if applicable) : http://james-ingram-act-two.de/open-source/assistantPerformer/assistantPerformer.html Computer: Acer Laptop, Windows 8.1 (64bit) Other browsers tested: Firefox 31 + Jazz plugin: Jazz's author says that the Microsoft GS Wavetable Synth appears on his Windows 8 machine. On my Windows 8.1 machine it does not. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to the above link on Windows 8.1 (on another machine running Windows 7 there is no problem.) 2. Open the output devices popup menu What is the expected result? All available MIDI output devices are listed What happens instead? The Microsoft GS Wavetable Synth is missing. Please provide any additional information below. Tom White of the MIDI Manufacturers associaton said: I asked a web app developer at Yamaha to check your problem with > Windows 8, and he was able to get the MS GS Synth to display in > his Web app... but he also observed that it would not display if > another app accessed the device first... maybe you can check if > that was the problem? > > - TW The Yamaha developer said: >> I have investigated a little bit more with basic Web MIDI App on >> Windows 8.1 (Sorry I do not have 8.0 PC around). >> >> For (a) = http://webmusic.jp/test_webmidi/hotplug02.html >> >> 1. Access "(a)", then Run DAW: "MS GS Synth" comes to the List >> >> 2. Run DAW, then Access "(a)": "MS GS Synth" DOES NOT come to the List >> >> The case is that the "MS GS Synth" does not list when the DAW (or any >> other applications which use MIDI devices) is running before the browser >> starts. >> >> It looks Windows is doing exclusive control, so MIDI devices, which >> is grabbed by application, are locked to use from other application. I have tried disabling Windows Media Player and restarting without it. But the problem persists. I've also tried disabling all the startup processes in the Task Manager, and restarting, but that does not help either.

title.$t: Close 'x' button on the new GAIA card is not accessible enough

content.$t:
Focus area of the button is too small. 

Even when it looks for the user that he's pointing on the button (see screenshot), the click might not lead to 'close' action. You should centralize your click better.

Also the button doesn't have hovered state, so it's not visible whether the button is in the mouse focus or not.

title.$t: Add UMA stat for content verification failures of force installed extensions

content.$t: We're trying to figure out the frequency of malware targeting force installed extensions, which are not currently disabled when content verification fails. The data we gather with this metric will help us determine the best solution for when content verification detects modification of a force installed extension (issue 447040).

title.$t: Having two cronet.jar confuses people

content.$t: Many people mistook the cronet.jar in lib.java for the one in cronet_package. We should rename the former so that people won't spend timing trying to figure out why building on the first one crashes the app.

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: connect() blocks until accept().

content.$t:
ARC runtime version: ToT
App version: ToT

Chrome: ToT
Platform: ToT

Repro steps:
s1 = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STRAM, 0);
bind(s1, { localhost, 12345 });
listen(s1, 1);

s2 = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STRAM, 0);
connect(s2, { localhost, 12345 });  // (1)

Expected behavior:
- return success immediately at (1).

Actual behavior:
- block.

Note: Current implementation blocks connect() request until accept() is invoked on other thread or process.

Note:
At least following CTS are affected:
cts.CtsNetTestCases:android.net.cts.LocalServerSocketTest#testLocalServerSocket 
cts.CtsNetTestCases:android.net.cts.LocalSocketTest#testLocalConnections

title.$t: mjpeg memory leak

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. open any mjpeg stream. we use axis camera and its web-interface for that
2. open task manager->details and observer memory consumption
3. once the tab with mjpeg consumes 4gb, it crashes

What is the expected behavior?
tab not to consume memory. but stay on constant memory usage, not growing

What went wrong?
memory got leaked which caused tab to crash

Crashed report ID: no

How much crashed? Just one tab

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes 2 or 3 weeks ago everything was ok

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

we've tested the issue on several computers.
the easiest way to reproduce is to open any axis camera in mjpeg mode from chrome (enter its url in chrome). you'll need at least 10 fps to reproduce the behaviour guaranteed
you'll see video on that page, and if you open task manager, you'll see that tab which having this <img src=".../mjpeg"> will eat memory at about 2mb per second. after 10 minutes it eats 4gb and tab crashes.
this is very huge problem for our business as we're using axis cameras really heavily. for now we're switching to firefox, which has no such problem. but previous versions of chrome also haven't. we can observe it about last 2 weeks.
can you please fix this  as it is very important for us and  i guess - any users of axis cameras

Implementation:
with a whitespace: 'multipart/form-data; boundary='

title.$t: OpenVPN error dialog is shown on third party VPN connection timeout

When third party VPN client does not respond to a connect message, the system times out and shown openVPN error dialog.

Instead of showing the openVPN error dialog and error signal should be sent to the third party VPN client so it can respond to the error message.

title.$t: Chrome Notification Clicks Don't Bring Chrome to Foreground

content.$t: Version: 43.0.2341.0 (Official Build) canary (64-bit) OS: Mac OS X What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. go to https://simple-push-demo.appspot.com/ and enable push messaging 2. Copy the CURL command 3. Open a terminal and place the window on top of Chrome 4. Paste the CURL command in to cause a push message to be triggered and show a notification 5. Click the notification What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Chrome to open the URL as a result of the notification click and to come to the foreground of other applications. What happens instead is it always seems to be behind the current foreground window

title.$t: Chrome Mobile Policy: describe your issue

content.$t: Chrome Version : <Copy from: 'about:version'> URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 6: Firefox 20: IE 7/8/9/10: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. 2. 3. What is the expected result? What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: I-beam cursor doesn't blink in the sync passphrase box

content.$t: Version: <43.0.2345.0> OS: <Linux Ubuntu 12.04> What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Enable "choose what to sync" check box > Sign in to chrome with an account which has "Sync Passphrase". 2.Now click on "Advanced sync settings" button > Select "sync everything dropdown" and select "choose what to sync". 3.Observe the I-beam cursor in the passphrase box. What is the expected output? The cursor should blink after selecting any of the option from sync passphrase dropdown. What do you see instead? The cursor doesn't blink after selecting any of the option from sync passphrase dropdown. This is a Regression issue broken in M-41. Issue is not seen in Windows OS.

title.$t: Zoomed site incorrectly shows scrollbar on parts of page

title.$t: credential_manager_types.h should be embedder-agnostic

content.$t:
credential_manager_types.h currently lives in components/password_manager/content, restricting the use of the types it contains (CredentialInfo, CredentialType, come constants) to Blink-based browsers. The only Blink-specific code it contains, however, is a convenience constructor that populates from a blink::WebCredential.

Extracting the Blink-specific constructor into a factory function that stays in components/password_manager/content while moving the rest of the embedder-agnostic credential_manager_types.h to components/password_manager/core will allow this code to be reused on e.g. iOS, which can implement its own factory function in components/password_manager/ios.

title.$t: BoringSSL: Enable SHA SSE optimization for x86

content.$t:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
In crypto/sha/asm/{sha1-586.pl, sha256-586.pl, sha512-586.pl}, there are switches that generate SSE2 assembly code if -DOPENSSL_IA32_SSE2 is in the CFLAGS.

This used to work for openssl, but not working for boringssl.

By enabling SSE2 optimization (turning sse2=1 in those 3 Perl scripts), I observed significant improvement in bssl speed tests.

Speed test results on 4 core Intel(R) Atom(TM) CPU  Z3770  @ 1.46GHz - built for Andorid using NDK

Default
=======
Did 4199000 SHA-1 (16 bytes) operations in 3000580us (1399396.1 ops/sec): 22.4 MB/s
Did 1338000 SHA-1 (256 bytes) operations in 3001369us (445796.6 ops/sec): 114.1 MB/s
Did 61000 SHA-1 (8192 bytes) operations in 3027299us (20150.0 ops/sec): 165.1 MB/s
Did 2333000 SHA-256 (16 bytes) operations in 3000998us (777408.0 ops/sec): 12.4 MB/s
Did 613000 SHA-256 (256 bytes) operations in 3003475us (204096.9 ops/sec): 52.2 MB/s
Did 26040 SHA-256 (8192 bytes) operations in 3028037us (8599.6 ops/sec): 70.4 MB/s
Did 843000 SHA-512 (16 bytes) operations in 3003144us (280705.8 ops/sec): 4.5 MB/s
Did 309000 SHA-512 (256 bytes) operations in 3000258us (102991.1 ops/sec): 26.4 MB/s
Did 15097 SHA-512 (8192 bytes) operations in 3018667us (5001.2 ops/sec): 41.0 MB/s

SSE2
====
Did 5023000 SHA-1 (16 bytes) operations in 3000515us (1674046.0 ops/sec): 26.8 MB/s
Did 1819000 SHA-1 (256 bytes) operations in 3000349us (606262.8 ops/sec): 155.2 MB/s
Did 89000 SHA-1 (8192 bytes) operations in 3014537us (29523.6 ops/sec): 241.9 MB/s
Did 3027000 SHA-256 (16 bytes) operations in 3000710us (1008761.3 ops/sec): 16.1 MB/s
Did 873000 SHA-256 (256 bytes) operations in 3002120us (290794.5 ops/sec): 74.4 MB/s
Did 39000 SHA-256 (8192 bytes) operations in 3056187us (12761.0 ops/sec): 104.5 MB/s
Did 1093000 SHA-512 (16 bytes) operations in 3000078us (364323.9 ops/sec): 5.8 MB/s
Did 415000 SHA-512 (256 bytes) operations in 3000879us (138292.8 ops/sec): 35.4 MB/s
Did 21352 SHA-512 (8192 bytes) operations in 3077112us (6939.0 ops/sec): 56.8 MB/s

What is the expected behavior?
The gain is easily 20+%. Can we enable SSE2 for these algorithms on X86?

What went wrong?
SSE2 assembly code not enabled.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: L
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Reconsider Packaged Apps compatibility with Public Sessions

content.$t:
This FR is to allow private packaged apps to be used in Public Sessions on devices enrolled within the same domain.

Currently we allow private hosted apps to be configured for use in Public Sessions, but not private packaged apps.

Additionally, only a handful of public packaged apps have been whitelisted for use in Public Sessions (eg. Citrix Receiver App: crbug.com/420726), so so this FR would allow for organisations to provide additional functionality for their devices in Public Sessions through developing/customising their own packaged apps for use on their enrolled devices.

title.$t: Chrome sometimes confuses favicons of visited and bookmarked websites.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.60 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Bookmark a set of webpages.
2. Visit multiple additional websites.
3. Clear Chrome's history.
4. Restart the computer and relaunch Chrome.
5. Continue additional web browsing.

What is the expected behavior?
The favicons displayed on the bookmarks bar do not change from the correct favicon to a completely different website's favicon.

What went wrong?
Chrome incorrectly remembered favicons of bookmarked websites and instead confused website's favicons.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.60  Channel: beta
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

If this issue is not reproducible, please try disabling the enhanced bookmarks experiment. If this issue is not reproducible with the enhanced bookmarks experiment disabled, please try enabling it.

title.$t: Request: Stop blocking window.open in getUserMedia success callback
Touchscreen:  no way to open new tab to background with touchscreen; ctrl-touch/click used to work, now it doesn't

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open a webpage 
2. Hold down Ctrl-Click and touch the link on your touchscreen
3. The new tab comes up in focus

What is the expected behavior?
The new tab should come up in the background

What went wrong?
Chrome used to treat ctrl-touch/click the same as ctrl-click with the mouse pointer which made sense.  It also treated all of the other new tab controls (ctrl-shift-click = open new tab in focus, alt-click = open in new window) consistently between mouse pointer and touchscreen.

Now, ctrl-touch works exactly the same as ctrl-shift-touch - it opens the tab in the foreground.

Unfortunately, this means that it's impossible to open new tabs in the background using a touchscreen.

open new tabs in the background, now it opens the new tab in focus and there is no way to open the tab in the background using the touchscreen - it is only possible using the mouse pointer.

Did this work before? Yes Unknown version

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: 

I don't care if we change the modifier key for open-to-background (though I think it's silly because both IE and FFox open tabs to background with ctrl-click - they are at least consistent) but would love to have this capability back.

Perhaps make it configurable?  I've read other threads where people asked for ctrl-click to open tabs in the foreground because they didn't want to press the ctrl-shift key.

No offense, but this is outright silly.  Who cares what modifier keys you press to do it - as long as you can do it.

And right now, we can't open tabs in the background with a touchscreen.

title.$t: No SeaBIOS display (Auron/Yuna/Paine)

UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36
Platform: 6913.0.0 (official build) dev-channel auron_yuna test

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. cross_system dev_boot_legacy=1
2. Reboot
3. Ctrl-L

What is the expected behavior?
SeaBIOS menu appears

What went wrong?
Black screen: neither SeaBIOS nor syslinux displays anything on screen.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 43.02344.0  Channel: dev
OS Version: 43.0.2344.0
Flash Version: 17.0.0.141-r1

Reproduced with firmware Google_Auron_yuna.6301.59.5, which seems to be the latest. Also seen on Paine.

With good timing and muscle memory (ESC, 2,...) it's still possible to boot syslinux "in the dark" and see kernel boot logs displayed soon after (assuming "quiet" has been removed from syslinux/usb.A.cfg). So this looks like a pure display issue.

title.$t: Chrome Remote Desktop on Windows does not remap from Win to Command keys

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.104 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open a CRD session with a Windows client and MacOS host.
2. Press a Cmd+??? shortcut.
3. Observe the lack of response from the MacOS host.

What is the expected behavior?
The MacOS host registers the keypress.

What went wrong?
Nothing happens, although depending on the key combination, Windows might intercept it and respond to it itself.  It is the same (lack of) behavior regardless if the CRD client is run full-screen or in its own window, regardless if I'm using an external USB keyboard or the built-in laptop one.

WebStore page: Chrome Remote Desktop, build 41.0.2272.41

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 8.1 (build 6.3.9600)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

The Chrome Apps V2 Key Event Tester picks up the Windows key just fine, producing the following json:
PNaCl KeyboardInputEvent = {
 "type": "KEYUP",
 "modifiers": 2048,
 "keyCode": 91,
 "characterText": "",
 "code": "OSLeft"
}

When I connect using a Linux client (with the Win key remapped to Meta) to the same MacOS host, I can transmit the Cmd key just fine.

title.$t: In add_point, should check for "reserved" names.

content.$t:
Datastore doesn't allow entities with names that start and end with "__".

(See google/apphosting/datastore/shared/BaseDatastoreValidator.java isReservedString.)

Therefore, the perf dashboard shouldn't accept test names like this.

title.$t: Scaling of elements (bookmark bar, omnibox, tabs, extensions) needs DPI adjustment

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Background: I have a 14 inch laptop on 1920x1080 resolution with Win 8.1. The default DPI scaling out of the box is "Medium - 125%"

1. On 125%, the UI elements (bookmark bar, omnibox, tabs, extensions) are too small on my 14 inch screen.
2. On 150%, the UI elements are properly adjusted and easily visible without strain
3. Choosing a custom DPI scaling "126%" properly adjusts the UI elements to the scale comparable to 150%, but many other Windows UI elements don't scale gracefully at 126%
4. Can there be an option to scale higher at 125% (comparable to 150%) on my 14 inch screen? I feel like any screen that requires 125% scaling for easier visibility would benefit from a higher scaled Chrome UI

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
Chrome doesn't scale high enough at 125% DPI and the UI is hard to see on my 14 inch screen

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Mac: Pepper Flash system installed plugin does not load due to x-ppapi-arch change in manifest.json

content.$t: Version: Chromium revision fea84635 (#321386) OS: Mac OS X 10.9.5 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install the system version of PPAPI Flash 17 from https://get2.adobe.com/flashplayer/otherversions/ 2. Build Chromium locally or run Google Chrome with the `--disable-bundled-ppapi-flash` command-line flag. 3. Load http://www.adobe.com/software/flash/about/ What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The system Flash plugin should be loaded successfully. Instead, the plugin is not loaded. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Flash player installs to the "/Library/Internet Plug-Ins/PepperFlashPlayer" directory. The value of "x-ppapi-arch" in manifest.json has changed to "mac" and PepperFlashPlayer.plugin now contains a universal binary. The check in CheckPepperFlashManifest (chrome/common/pepper_flash.cc) needs to be updated to accept this new value.

content.$t: |perf_data| has been moved to within |sampled_profile|.

title.$t: Convert Blink fractional scroll offsets to double precision

content.$t:
With the ongoing work to add fractional scroll offsets to Blink we now seem to be mixing Floats and Doubles in a number of places:

PinchViewport uses Floats (as does the applyViewportDeltas API)
ScrollAnimator uses Floats
ScrollableArea and subclasses use Double
Lots of random code dealing with scale assumes float

I had an issue (gone now in ToT after https://codereview.chromium.org/1015273002) due to doubles from CC being converted to floats in Blink, losing precision, and causing unintended scrolls (issue 466727) so I think we need to get everything on the same page.

I'd like to go ahead and convert all scroll offsets in Blink to doubles, perhaps typedef'ing DoublePoint to ScrollOffset, using DoubleRect for frame rects, etc. Any objections?

title.$t: No Minimize/Maximize/Close Buttons when window is maximized

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open Google Chrome
2. Make sure the window is maximized
3. Look at the place where the Minimize/Maximize/Close Buttons are supposed to be

What is the expected behavior?
The Minimize/Maximize/Close Buttons exist and are functional when the browser is both maximized AND windowed (as in not maximized).

What went wrong?
The Minimize/Maximize/Close Buttons do not exist and cannot therefor be clicked on. See "Figure 2" for details. If the window is not maximized, the buttons appear normal and can be clicked on. See "Figure 3" for details.

Did this work before? Yes Chrome 37

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: Kubuntu 14.10 (Kernel 3.16.0-31)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

My window manager is kWin.

This is a really weird bug.

title.$t: Applying a Chrome theme causes URLs to appear blurry.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.60 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Install My Chrome Theme.
2. Create a custom Chrome theme and install it.
3. Relaunch Chrome.
4. Hover over a link. The small text displaying the link's URL to the bottom left or sometimes bottom right of Chrome is now blurry and distorted.

What is the expected behavior?
The custom theme does not interfere with Chrome's text and font readability.

What went wrong?
The custom theme interferes with Chrome's text and font quality and causes blurriness and distortion.

WebStore page: My Chrome Theme

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.60  Channel: beta
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Implement ink drop animation for ChromeOS MD touch feedback

content.$t: Tracking bug for implementing the "ink drop" touch feedback animation to be used for various ChromeOS UI surfaces.

title.$t: GPU process consumes much more memory when connected to a 4k display

content.$t:
I suspect this is normal but it's worth thinking about at least.

In the discussion on https://code.google.com/p/chrome-os-partner/issues/detail?id=38169 it was reported that connecting a 4k display greatly increases the memory footprint of the GPU process.

My guess is we simply have to allocate a larger buffer and there's no way around this.

title.$t: Chrome Remote Desktop consumes full CPU even in the background

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/40.0.2214.111 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open a CRD session.
2. switch to another Chrome window

What is the expected behavior?
CRD session uses greatly reduced CPU.

What went wrong?
CRD session continues using ~200% CPU across the following tasks:
- Background Page: Chrome Remote Desktop
- App: Crhome Remote Desktop
- Plug-in: Chrome Remote Desktop Viewer
- GPU Process

Did this work before? Yes Yesterday; before the most recent CRD update

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 16.0 r0

Previously, I could switch to another tab, and CRD CPU usage would drop. With the new windowed CRD, this is not an option.

Hiding the CRD window *does* result in a substantial CPU drop.

title.$t: Add test to check expected thread names.

content.$t: We should add a test in content/test/gpu/gpu_tests/trace_test.py that checks the expected thread names to prevent changes that will cause our performance test to start reporting the wrong values.

title.$t: Want to watch DOM changes in slow motion (or playback?)

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Something changes in the DOM that change it significantly, or many times
2. Like a jQuery animation function
3. It's hard to see as it moves quickly

Example (animated gif): http://zippy.gfycat.com/AllComposedEasternglasslizard.gif

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
It would be very useful to somehow watch this in slow motion, and even stop it in mid-execution to allow to debug.

Currently I've been pausing the sources panel, which would allow me to stop the changes happening to the DOM, but things like animations affecting the DOM are very hard to debug in detail when you're watching the values changing so quickly.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: n/a
OS Version: OS X 10.9.5
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Drags from download bar button separate from mouse cursor

content.$t:
M42beta
OSX 10.10.2

- Download something so the download bar shows up. Wait for it to finish.
- drag on the text of the button, not the icon.

expected:
- file icon should be under the pointer during the drag

actual:
- file icon separated from the pointer by the offset into the text where you clicked

This looks really weird having an icon floating and disassociated with the mouse pointer. This should be pretty easy to fix, just fix the pinning offset at the drag creation site.

Giving to Jayson because he brought it up at convergence :-) ;-)

title.$t: testRunner.displayAsyncThen after notifyDone leaks document

content.$t:
$ cat ~/leak.html
<script>
testRunner.dumpAsText();
testRunner.notifyDone();
testRunner.displayAsyncThen(function() {});
</script>

$ out/Debug/content_shell --run-layout-test --enable-leak-detection ~/leak.html
#READY
Content-Type: text/plain

#EOF
#EOF
There are 2 documents currently alive:
- Document 0x2928c3004bd0 URL: file:///usr/local/google/home/skobes/leak.html
- Document 0x2928c3005790 URL: about:blank
#LEAK - renderer pid 23490 ({"numberOfLiveDocuments":[1,2],"numberOfLiveNodes":[4,11]})
#EOF

Without --enable-leak-detection, no error is produced by calling displayAsyncThen after notifyDone.  This makes it easy for a test to pass the CQ and then fail on the leak bots.

title.$t: Unable to override host/native objects (for example, CSSStyleDeclaration)

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:31.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/31.0

Steps to reproduce the problem:
The code below produces "overridden" in Firefox, but "" in Chrome:

Object.defineProperty(CSSStyleDeclaration.prototype, 'cssText', {
    get: function () { return 'overridden'; }
});
document.createElement('style').style.cssText;

What is the expected behavior?
Getters (and setters) on native objects should work as expected: The code above should return "overridden".

What went wrong?
The getter on CSSStyleDeclaration's prototype seems to be ignored.

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version: 40.0.2214.111 (Developer Build) Ubuntu 14.04  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: 

I am researching cookie-less tracking/browser fingerprinting using a browser extension (https://www.eff.org/about/staff/alexei-miagkov). The extension injects scripts into browsed pages to intercept JS property accesses. It does this in order to analyze page JS activity, and override certain values for privacy protection.

Chrome's inability to override native object getters (and setters) is a problem because it seems to leave no good (synchronous) way of globally intercepting CSS updates.

It is not enough to detect updates after the fact using (async) Mutation Observers because we can neither find the originating script (the script that performed the updates) through a stack trace, nor can we alter the results of host object accesses.

For example, Tor Browser protects its users against font enumeration (a browser fingerprinting technique) by limiting font accesses. This protection should be possible through a browser extension, but isn't because of this issue.

title.$t: Bring up autofill suggestions after initial focus

content.$t:
Currently we only bring up the autofill suggestion menu on desktop when you click again (field must already be focused, so this effectively a double-click) or you start typing.

This is annoying, it should be easier to bring up autofill suggestions, especially now that we're getting better at filling these in. We do this on Android already.

The reason we don't do this on desktop is that if the autofill suggestions are incorrect, the autofill popup will appear for each element in the form, which is annoying. On mobile the difficulty of typing vs. giving suggestions leads us to optimize for the opposite case.

We should have some heuristics to make the "autofill is wrong" case less annoying, and then start showing suggestions for initial click or focus. This probably means something along the lines of skipping the suggestions if autofill has already popped up for that form section but was not used.

title.$t: Mac idle wakeups: Many wakeups in CAOpenGLLayer in GPU process

content.$t: Version: Mac 43.0.2344.0 1. Navigate to data:text/html,<input> 2. Run "sudo timerfires -p XYZ -t 20" where XYZ is the gpu PID. 3. Move the focus to the input field, so that the cursor flashes What is the expected output? What do you see instead? We get 371 idle wakeups, of which 237 of them are calls to CAOpenGLLayer_timer_callback. If we use [CAOpenGLLayer setNeedsDisplay] to drive new frames instead of [CAOpenGLLayer setAsynchronous:YES], then the number of idle wakeups drops to 168. We may want to transition to this mode more hesitantly, or transition out of this mode more aggressively. There is some work to this effect in https://codereview.chromium.org/994763002, although, evidently, this was not sufficiently effective.

title.$t: Regressions in smoothness image_decoding_cases

content.$t:
Looks like there are some major perf regressions in image_decoding_cases.

On 3/14 there is a bump of ~25% in mean_frame_time with GPU raster, but a reduction of ~20% with software raster.  The smoking gun looks like crrev.com/985583002

I also see prior bumps on 3/24 and 3/27 affecting GPU and software.

These would be good image-team issues to track down as a high priority.  I've opened an issue to get performance alerts on these benchmarks: crbug.com/470603.


GPU mean_frame_times:

 https://chromeperf.appspot.com/report?masters=ChromiumPerf&bots=android-nexus4%2Candroid-nexus5&tests=smoothness.gpu_rasterization_and_decoding.image_decoding_cases%2Fmean_frame_time&checked=all&start_rev=313070&end_rev=322142

title.$t: No way to reference SVG elements by id in the presence of a <base> element

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.89 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
http://plnkr.co/edit/Q02ctZwY4U2uIPHigaFl?p=preview

Steps to reproduce the problem:
See the attached link, which shows a document with a <base> element, and contains an <svg> with a gradient it attempts to reference by id.

What is the expected behavior?

What went wrong?
The gradient url(#...) reference breaks, presumably because the base element is resolving the fragment relative to the specified base.

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? No Firefox, Safari tip

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.89  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

It's very difficult to tell what this ought to be doing according to the spec (so many specs apply, yay!). But unless I'm missing something obvious, it appears that the existence of a <base> renders it *impossible* to reference any other element via url(#id) in SVG. Whatever the spec(s) say(s), I find it difficult to imagine that this was the intent.

title.$t: Touchscreen isn't detected unless used before browser starts

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/39.0.2171.65 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Start touchscreen computer (HP 21) with autologin and Chromium configured to autostart 
2. *touch nothing*
3. When browser starts, touch events are not recognized; ontouch* handlers do not run, etc.

If the screen is touched at any point before the browser starts, touch events will immediately work.

What is the expected behavior?
Chrome should be able to use the touchscreen immediately

What went wrong?
If the touch interface isn't used before Chrome starts, it will not be available.
- Forcing flags#touch-events to Enabled does not fix the problem
- starting Chrome with --touch-events=enabled and/or --touch-device=(touchscreen xinput ID) does not fix the problem
- starting Chrome, then closing and restarting appeared to fix the problem, but the process was actually "start Chrome; try to interact with touch-based web app; close & restart; touch works".

Chrome version: 39.0.2171.65  Channel: stable
OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04.01
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 15.0 r0

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Consider disabling patchoat invocation

content.$t: In order to have some level of ASLR, Android calls patchoat to relocate all (build-time) AOT images and executables. The problem with that is that it degrades first boot time considerably (up to 40s in some extreme cases) and we are running in a sandboxed environment anyways. Some of our targets don't even have ASLR (like NaCl x86_64, where all binaries addresses depend only on load order, and we even hardcode the address of the AOT boot image).

title.$t: Fix missing symbols blocking pre-linking of the Cast sender library for iOS simulator

content.$t:
Probably due to linker bugs, a number of missing symbols prevent pre-linking of the Cast sender library for the iOS simulator. Builds for iOS hardware work fine (the missing symbols are not a problem because they are never used and removed by the dead code elimination pass). As far as I can inspect the libraries, they are roughly the same between Intel and ARM.

In any case, after trying to bash the linker every which way for days, the only working solution is to define those missing symbols, or to remove the need for them by stubbing out any exported symbol that use them.

Pre-linking is the process by which multiple object files and static archives can be merged by the linker resolving symbols in the process. This yields a considerable size reduction over the sum of the static libraries because the list of exported symbols can be controlled and therefore any symbol unreachable from that list is eliminated.

title.$t: SVG <use> element blocking cross-domain requests, with no option to use CORS

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.89 Safari/537.36

Example URL:

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create a page on `a.com` with SVG such as the following:

    <svg>
      <use xlink:href="https://b.com/some.svg#some-id"></use>
    </svg>

2. Place `some.svg` on b.com, with response header:

    Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *

What is the expected behavior?
The SVG <use> reference renders the SVG fetched from `b.com`.

What went wrong?
"Unsafe attempt to load URL https://b.com/some.svg from frame with URL https://a.com/some.html. Domains, protocols and ports must match."

Does it occur on multiple sites: Yes

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? N/A 

Does this work in other browsers? No Firefox, Safari tip

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.89  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

It's not really clear from the spec (e.g., http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/linking.html) that there's any reason for this not to work. It does make sense that this request would be blocked without CORS headers (even though it's not clearly specified), but I would at least expect it to try CORS before simply blocking the request.

title.$t: ARC: gdb backtrace does not always work on -t=ba

content.$t:
gdb backtrace does not always work on -t=ba.

ARC runtime version: tot bd5fcee3506116075d1ffd90eb8cdad75951874c

Repro steps:
1) ./configure -t=ba --opt --disable-debug-code && ninja
2) ./launch_chrome run --remote=<ARM> --gdb=plugin

Actual:

Program received signal SIGINT, Interrupt.
0xb669bdd2 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0xb669bdd2 in ?? ()
#1  0x00000000 in ?? ()
(gdb) info threads
[...]
  Id   Target Id         Frame 
  53   Thread 22315      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  52   Thread 22290      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  51   Thread 22289      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  50   Thread 22287      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  49   Thread 22208      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  48   Thread 22206      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  47   Thread 22205      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  46   Thread 22202      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  45   Thread 22200      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  44   Thread 22199      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  43   Thread 22198      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  42   Thread 22197      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()
  41   Thread 22196      0xb6698ce0 in ?? ()

Two issues:

* gdb does not know anything about target's non-ARC shared libraries like /lib/libc.so.6. There is a fix for this: https://chrome-internal-review.googlesource.com/#/c/210230/
* gdb cannot show backtrace when a thread is in such a library. gdb can show backtrace when it's in ARC's library (e.g. Bionic and arc.nexe) though.

title.$t: Flake with cc_unittests using --single-process-tests

content.$t:
Run cc_unittests --single-process-tests (only confirmed on windows)

Occasionally a test will crash due to us accessing deleted memory (I suspect).  It's not always the same test, suggesting a race.  Here are a few of the tests that have crashed on me:

SynchronousGpuRasterizationRasterizesVisibleOnly.RunMultiThread_DelegatingRenderer_ImplSidePaint
ThreadedGpuRasterizationRasterizesBorderTiles.RunMultiThread_DelegatingRenderer_ImplSidePaint
ThreadedGpuRasterizationRasterizesBorderTiles.RunMultiThread_DirectRenderer_ImplSidePaint
RasterizeWithGpuRasterizationCreatesResources.RunMultiThread_DelegatingRenderer_ImplSidePaint

Running any of these tests repeated 100 times does not reproduce the problem.

Callstack for RasterizeWithGpuRasterizationCreatesResources.RunMultiThread_DelegatingRenderer_ImplSidePaint:

title.$t: If sync detects we're at critical memory pressure levels, consider shutting down some or all of sync

content.$t:
Particularly on IOS or Android, memory pressure can greatly impact the stability of the application. Sync, as a non-critical feature than can sometimes consume large amounts of memory, might be a good candidate for shutdown when memory pressure limits are reached.

To do this we can add a MemoryPressureListener that listens to MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_CRITICAL events and then triggers either reconfiguration w/o certain dataytypes or full shutdown.

Open questions:
1. Should we do it anytime the critical event fires, or only if we have XXX entries in sync, and therefore are likely a significant source of memory pressure ourselves
2. Should we shut down all of sync, or just a subset of datatypes that are known to be expensive?
3. Does shutting down sync introduce _more_ risk for memory issues? Note that shutdown itself will trigger a flush to disk which can be expensive on its own.
4. Will shutting down a datatype/sync itself interrupt an expensive sync event, such as bookmark model association?
5. Can we detect if a memory issue previously caused a crash, and act on that to proactively shut down sync before memory limits are approached?
6. Should we combine having some actions on MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_MODERATE followed by more drastic actions on MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_CRITICAL? For example, if we detect a MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_MODERATE before configuration, perhaps we don't turn on bookmark sync.

I suspect we should at least get some basic functionality in ASAP (such as shutting down sync at critical levels), before digging into anything more complex, but we need to at least make sure it won't make things worse first.

title.$t: Console will not remember its position for incognito windows

content.$t: Chrome Version : 43.0.2342.2 OS Version: OS X 10.9.5 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open the console, position it to the bottom 2. Notice that closing and re-opening the browser, it remembers its position at the bottom 3. Now open an incognito window, open the console 4. Notice that it is positioned to the right, move it to the bottom 5. Close incognito window, open another, open console 6. Notice that it is now back on the right What is the expected result? I expect that the console position remain where I placed it. Even if incognito windows don't share a preference with regular windows, the console position should be remembered from incognito session to session What happens instead of that? The console opens to the right every time I start a fresh incognito session, despite me positioning it to the bottom. It behaves as expected in standard windows, this bug is only present in incognito windows UserAgentString: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_5) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/43.0.2342.2 Safari/537.36

title.$t: StereoPannerNode produces a glitch when pan value changes from positive to zero or negative.
Investigate kPixelDistanceToRecord

content.$t: It seems that no matter how we reduce the overheads, well still have them which affects the performance of the first painting. kPixelDistanceToRecord affects the amount of painting. Perhaps we can determine the parameter dynamically to reduce the amount of first painting. For example, we could begin with a small pixelDistanceToRecord then increase it until it reaches the maximum. Our display item caching mechanism should be able to handle the incremental painting effectively.

title.$t: Improve performance of DisplayItemList

content.$t: Performance analysis doc: https://docs.google.com/a/chromium.org/document/d/1YG3XDP9uAn7YNurmviodIm0UF7c5H3LeTxCLZbgjc_I/edit#

title.$t: Improve performance of GraphicsContext::beginRecording/endRecording

content.$t: In slimming paint we have much more calls to GraphicsContext::beginRecording/endRecording than non-SP. Profiling (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YG3XDP9uAn7YNurmviodIm0UF7c5H3LeTxCLZbgjc_I/edit?usp=sharing) shows that they contribute 20%+ of recording time, and perhaps slow down other painting operations due to unknown reasons.

title.$t: Turn down nexus 10 after nexus 9 is fully functional

content.$t: The nexus 10 bots are very unstable, and we only need one large tablet on the perf waterfall. Let's turn them down after nexus 9 is up.

title.$t: Chrome extension tabs zoom api should include GetDefaultZoom

content.$t: At present the extension tabs api allows an extension to get/set zoom levels, but there is no way for the extension to query the default zoom level (in the event it should want to set a zoom level to match it). We should add GetDefaultZoom() to the api. Please feel free to add additional stakeholders so we can get further input. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

Open hangouts extension on dual monitor system 2. Drag green Hangouts circle to secondary monitor. 3. Drag green Hangouts circle back to primary monitor What is the expected output? The green Hangouts circle should remain on the primary monitor screen. What do you see instead? After a brief delay, the circle "jumps" back to the secondary monitor, though not necessarily the same location it previously occupied on that monitor. title.$t: Move the active mixed content warning into the OIB

content.$t: Very few users interact with the active mixed content page action. Let's get rid of it and put something in the OIB instead.

title.$t: Move "blocked" page actions into the OIB

content.$t:
When something is blocked (e.g., a script or your camera), we currently show a page action and a bubble on the RHS. This leads to redundant UI, where there are multiple ways to toggle the setting (both the OIB and the RHS block bubble).

We should show something on the LHS of the origin instead. Maybe it could be in the OIB, with some kind of badge over the lock to show that something happened that might need your attention in the OIB?

title.$t: Undo the split of OmniboxBundledExperimentV1_CanaryDev into dogfood and non-dogfood versions

content.$t: To avoid confusion resulting from experimenters changing just one or the other. See discussion on https://critique.corp.google.com/#review/89422820. This can be done when the desktop Answers in Suggest dogfood is over.

title.$t: [New Multicolumn] Restricted height may trigger assertion failures in column balancer

content.$t:
If there isn't enough height available in a multicol container to fit some unbreakable content (such as lines), and we exceed used column-count during layout, we assert like this:

ASSERTION FAILED: m_minSpaceShortage != LayoutFlowThread::maxLogicalHeight()
../../third_party/WebKit/Source/core/layout/MultiColumnFragmentainerGroup.cpp(427) : blink::LayoutUnit blink::MultiColumnFragmentainerGroup::calculateColumnHeight(blink::BalancedColumnHeightCalculation) const

#3 0x00000341eb0f blink::MultiColumnFragmentainerGroup::calculateColumnHeight()
#4 0x00000341e733 blink::MultiColumnFragmentainerGroup::recalculateColumnHeight()
#5 0x0000033ab4a1 blink::LayoutMultiColumnSet::recalculateColumnHeight()
#6 0x0000033a840c blink::LayoutMultiColumnFlowThread::recalculateColumnHeights()
#7 0x0000033167c4 blink::LayoutBlockFlow::layoutBlockFlow()
#8 0x000003307978 blink::LayoutBlockFlow::layoutBlock()
#9 0x0000032e0682 blink::LayoutBlock::layout()

This makes fast/block/line-layout/line-break-removal-near-textarea-crash.html crash on Mac if running it with the new multicol implementation, due to -webkit-appearance: button imposing a min-height (which shouldn't really affect layout at all in this case, but that's issue 65731).

title.$t: Regression: Focus ring is not seen on "Disconnect your Google account" button in chrome://settings page.

content.$t: Chrome Version: 42.0.2311.60 (Official Build), 4017f4355d842ec6d42115683450bd853e5cf6cc-refs/branch-heads/2311@{#346}-32/64-bit. OS: All (Win 7 - Aero enabled) Precondition: Sign into chrome browser What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to chrome://settings and click on "Advance sync settings..." button under 'Sign in' section 2. Click "Cancel" button and observe (focus ring is seen on "Advance sync settings..." button) 3. Now, click on "Disconnect your Google account" button and click "Cancel" button 4. Observe "Disconnect your Google account" button No focus ring is seen on "Disconnect your Google account" button. Focus ring should be seen on "Disconnect your Google account" button as this is working fine for other overlays. This is an regression issue, broken in M-42 series and below is the narrow bisect info: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/288f7262645df68bda3b94091730bb6ea0d05d9f..82eb39ef448c9cab8020804a9e196f631c9afe05?pretty=fuller&n=20 Suspecting - r315251

title.$t: Admins are reporting that URLBlacklisting can not be used to prevent signin to personal Gaia accounts

content.$t:
Some admins would like to prevent users from accessing personal data from their Chromebooks (example: an EDU admin may want students to only access their school Google account, and not their personal Gmail account from their Chromebook).

Our canonical answer for this has been to use the URL blacklist policy to block access to the Gaia signin pages. 

Some admins have reported that this isn't working for them - we need to identify a supported URL blacklist configuration that will work for these users (which may require engineering work if the expected configuration isn't working) and document this in a help center article.

Also note http://crbug.com/443883 which is a FR for a specific policy setting that just disables signin automatically (without requiring maintaining URL blacklists).

title.$t: Tabs displayed under 'View site information' is not functional when system language changed to Arabic/Persian in Mac

content.$t: Version: Canary 43.0.2342.2 (Official Build) (64-bit) OS: Mac What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Change system language to 'Persian / Arabic' 2. Navigate any site (ex:apple.com) in chrome and click on 'view site information' (in the LHS of Omnibox) to view the 'Permissions' & 'Connections' - Observe What is the expected output? Not able to click on the two tabs. What do you see instead? Should able to click on the tabs to get the relevant information. Note : This is a non regression issue, existing from M23 builds. Issue specific to Mac only, working fine in Win7, Ubuntu 14.04

title.$t: Permission bubble can appear on top of the wrong window

content.$t: Version: M42-M43 (possibly earlier as well) OS: Windows 8.1 (have not tested other OS's) What steps will reproduce the problem? 0. Clear all media permissions, chrome://settings/contentExceptions#media-stream 1. Browse to a webrtc page, e.g. apprtc.appspot.com and join, leave the permission bubble be. 2. Open a new window (or tab and then drag it out as a window) 3. Alt tab between the windows twice What is the expected output? Permission bubble only visible on top of its origin window What do you see instead? Permission bubble sometimes appears on top of a non-origin window (window from step 2) It almost seems like it's a Windows bug as the window icon in the taskbar indicates the window with the permission bubble is highlighted but only the permission bubble is visible on top of the other window. Screenshot: https://drive.google.com/a/google.com/file/d/0BwwlrcPnEG-RSTY5R3NWLW0tczQ/view?usp=sharing

title.$t: Preferences and Local State are written multiple times during shutdown

content.$t:
By inserting LOG(ERROR)<<path.value() to ImportantFileWriter::WriteFileAtomically(), you can see Preferences and Local State being written multiple times during shutdown.
As ImportantFileWriter::WriteFileAtomically() is a very heavy operation, we should avoid this if possible.

Preferences is written multiple times because PrefService::CommitPendingWrite() is called by ProfileImpl::SetExitType().
IIUC ProfileImpl::SetExitType() shouldn't call CommitPendingWrite() because PrefService's dtor is responsible to call CommitPendingWrite().

The same goes for Local State.
browser_shutdown::ShutdownPreThreadsStop() and MarkAppCleanShutdownAndCommit (in metrics_service.cc) are calling CommitPendingWrite() for no good reason.

title.$t: invoke callback with deny state for geolocation.getCurrentPosition by default

content.$t:
When invoking geolocation.getCurrentPosition(..) from JavaScript running in WebView, currently no callbacks are executed at all in the following cases:
1. when no WebChromeClient is set,
2. when WebChromeClient is set but onGeolocationPermissionsShowPrompt is not overridden.

Reasonably in those cases at least an error callback should be invoked (saying that geolocation is denied by default).

title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Certificate collection logic mod was not correctly merged from K

content.$t:
Seems like certificate collection logic mod in PackageParser.java was not properly merged from K mod.
For example, K had a short-cut logic to skip reading the entire framework-res.apk for better performance, but it is read today. We should check (flags & PARSE_IS_SYSTEM) to see if we can skip it.

This issue can affect boot-time performance. Also this is a hidden cause of Issue 469616.

title.$t: HFP headset attempts to disconnect right after re-connection, but failed

content.$t:
Reproduced on Motorola HX550 headset. While audio streaming, power off headset, and then power it on to trigger a reconnect.

Below log shows the dbus reply from CRAS failed to send to bluetoothd, hence leave the HFP state in "disconnected" and never transitioned to "connected". At time [2015-03-25T17:22:10.532431] the device attempted to disconnect but due to the incorrect state (at 'disconnected'), the disconnect procedure didn't get started.

title.$t: Video jitters and massive frames are dropped on youtube playing MP4/H264 1080p 60fps through MSE

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
https://www.youtube.com/results?lclk=hour&filters=hour&search_query=60fps

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Go to youtube.com/html5 and make sure you have html5 player enabled and MSE & H.264 is recognized as supported.
2. Go to https://www.youtube.com/results?lclk=hour&filters=hour&search_query=60fps.
3. Find a video that has 1080p resolution and 60fps.
4. When the player loads turn on the "statistic for nerds", make sure the mime type is "video/mp4" and change the resolution to 1920 x 1080@60.
5. Observe the video jitters and massive frame drops, going to full screen may amplify the effect.

What is the expected behavior?
The video should play flawlessly - compare how videos coded with vp9 (video/webm) are played in this resolution.

What went wrong?
The problem lies in the hardware acceleration. The GPUVideoDecoder is faulty.

Did this work before? Yes I don't know the exact regresion point, but I'm sure it worked before.

Is it a problem with Flash or HTML5? HTML5

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.2 (Windows 8)
Flash Version:

title.$t: Files.app freeze when a user opens a folder in which contanins many files on MTP volume

content.$t: Version: ToT OS: ChromeOS What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Connect your MTP device, and try to open a folder which contains 1000 photos in it. 2. Files.app freezes just before it shows the last chunk of entries. (i.e. for a case with 1000 photos. It freezes at 975.jpg). 3. After waiting for a minute, the last chunk is shown. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The last chunk should be shown same as other chunks of entries. When we open the folder again, it shows them immediately. I inserted logs for ReadDirectory(DeviceMediaAsyncFileUtil) calls, and I can see that directory scan for neighbor? directories happen after the directory scan of current directory. Consider that we have /A, /B, /C, and /B contains 1000 photos. I can see the following behavior. ReadDirectory /B [Stops at 975.jpg] Completes /B with no more entry ReadDirectory /A ReadDirectory /B ReadDirectory /C Completes /A with no more entry Completes /B with no more entry Completes /C with no more entry [All photos are shown]

title.$t: Ability to select a secondary domain as name for Managed Bookmarks

content.$t:
This FR is to provide an admin control to show the name of a secondary domain (or domain alias) for the managed bookmarks folder on a client.

Currently, Managed Bookmarks are displayed as "company.com bookmarks", but ideally an admin would be able to select a separate domain name (eg. "subsidiaryA.com") to be displayed for devices in a particular OU.

This would provide additional flexibility for organisations having multiple domains/brands/subsidiaries where the name of the primary domain is not relevant to the end user.

Related FR: crbug.com/416454

title.$t: ARC: gdb for -t=ba cannot load NDK libraries

content.$t:
gdb running on Z620 for './launch_chrome run --remote=... --gdb=plugin NDK_app.apk' cannot load NDK libraries.

'./launch_chrome run --remote=... --gdb=plugin' for -t=ba should probably unzip NDK_app.apk to somewhere in /tmp
and let gdb search for the NDK libraries every time it hits __bare_metal_notify_gdb_of_load.

We can work around the limitation by manually unzipping the apk and copy all ARM DSOs to 
out/target/bare_metal_arm_opt/lib/, but doing so every time is a pain.

title.$t: networkingPrivate API: Support modification of per-network proxy settings

content.$t:
Currently, the settings page is using special WebUI handlers for per-network proxy settings.
To get rid of these handlers and to allow end-to-end auto tests for proxy settings, networkingPrivate API should support per-network proxy settings.

These settings are part of ONC and should fit well into the API.

title.$t: Next prediction window doesn't follow the cursor for some words.

content.$t: Chrome Version: 6.5.1.5 Chrome OS Version: Version 43.0.2342.0 canary 64-bit Chrome OS Platform: 6910.0.0 Firmware Google_Clapper 5216.199.7 Steps To Reproduce: 1. Go to US keyboard setting page. 2. Set Auto-correction to Aggressive, enable next word prediction. 3. Focus any input field. 4. Type word like "...tion", press SPACE. Expected Result: Next prediction window should follow the cursor. Actual Result: Next Prediction window appears below the previous word. Note: This issue not repro for all words, most repro for words like "...tion".

title.$t: Problem With Mali-400 GPU

content.$t: Device name: - Any device that uses Mali-400 GPU (or Mali-400MP), e,g. Samsung S3, Samsung S3 Mini, Samsung Note, Samsung Note II... Application version: - 41.0.2272.96 OS: - Any OS (tried 4.1.2, 4.3, 4.4.2) Problem 1: - Canvas draw drops the frame rate from 60 to 4 if the source image be a dynamically created canvas (even if just 1x1 pixel dimension)! If load the source image from a URL, the problem won't occur and will have normal high frame rate. Problem 2: - Even if simply try to draw an image which is loaded from a URL, still need to reset canvas in each frame (canvas.width=canvas.width;) to get the normal frame rate otherwise FPS drops to 4! Problem 3: - WebGL doesn't work anymore! It was working just fine in previous Chrome versions. Steps to reproduce "Problem 1": 1. Create a canvas element (document.createElement("canvas");) 2. Try to draw it in each frame (ctx.drawImage(createdCanvas,0,0);) 3. Check the frame rate! it will drop from 60 to 5 even if the created canvas be empty or just 1x1 size! Attached File: - I have attached a test html file, by simply opening that file in Android Chrome 41.0.2272.96 (or 42.x beta), you can observe the very low frame rate! - If set DRAW_CREATED_CANVAS to false (in its javascript code), FPS will jump to 60! - Related to "Problem 2": If don't draw created canvas (DRAW_CREATED_CANVAS=false), still need to reset canvas in each frame to get the high FPS, if set the RESET_CANVAS_IN_EACH_FRAME to false, will see that FPS drops again! In previous Chrome versions that was not needed. Should fix this as well because resetting the canvas doesn't let us to keep the old content and redraw only the changed parts.

title.$t: Disable HFP in M42

content.$t:
A bug still exist for when power off/on some BT headsets, the re-connection of A2DP will get into a state that audio connection cannot be established.
More detail in crosbug.com/p/38281

title.$t: Images drawn to HTML5 canvas occasionally not showing up

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_2) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.104 Safari/537.36

Example URL:
www.playdominion.com

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Play games on www.playdominion.com

What is the expected behavior?
The cards are always displayed correctly.

What went wrong?
In some games (20%?) some cards aren't displayed.

Does it occur on multiple sites: N/A

Is it a problem with a plugin? No 

Did this work before? Yes "a couple weeks ago"

Does this work in other browsers? Yes 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.X  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.2
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

The card-game site has been working fine for years, but in the last couple of weeks we've received complaints that in some games, the card images are not drawn (they are invisible). We have also had a Windows 8 user report that the cards would be drawn black and another user send a screenshot where garbage was drawn instead of the card. The common thread is that the users are all using Chrome 41.0.2272.x and do not experience this problem when trying other browsers. As nothing was changed with the website, our assumption is a recent build of Chrome broke this.

Example reports: http://forum.makingfun.com/showthread.php?6249-Disappearing-cards

The site is using the HTML5 canvas for this drawing.

Marketplace Apps shouldn't appear as deployable Chrome extensions, they are simple manifest.json files with icons that appear to use the Chrome Web Store as a backend, but these "extensions" aren't meant to be deployed or installed in this manner. title.$t: Use flashmap descriptors to produce more extensible firmware images

content.$t:
Now that we have a working compiler for the new flashmap descriptor format (see bug 461875), we should actually use the FMAPs it generates to produce firmware images that consist of more than just a CBFS. Making and manipulating such images will the task of an extended version of today's cbfstool. In particular, cbfstool will get the following new functionality:
- Improved "create" action that reads a precompiled FMAP file, lays out the image appropriately, inserts the FMAP at the right place, and initializes (multiple) CBFSes.
- New "write" and "read" actions for adding and extracting "blobs" to/from sections of the image that only contain binary data, rather than a CBFS.
- New command-line switch to specify which FMAP section actions deal with.

Some specific challenges that need to be addressed in the process:
- We need to be able to find the FMAP in the image, both when manipulating it with our utils on the host system and when actually booting on target hardware. We plan to accomplish this by repurposing the quadword of padding at the end of the CBFS master header to store the offset to the FMAP region.
- CONFIG_CBFS_SIZE is needed in several places at compile-time, including when generating the bootstub; however, we want to avoid duplicating information between Kconfig and fmd files. We'll process the fmd file before we compile sources, and generate a header that sits alongside config.h at that time.
- Since flashmaps are going to be come mandatory, we'll need to check in a set of "template" fmd files for common architecture/flash size combinations.

title.$t: System does not exit dark resume upon receiving keypress in kernel suspend path

content.$t:
Is a (servo) keypress is received on the system's suspend path (i.e. after userspace actions have completed but before the system actually enters S3), the system does not wake up fully. This is probably because the keypress is consumed by the kernel, never reaches Chrome, therefore causing Chrome to not send a user activity detected signal to the power manager.

This turned up as an issue in wake on WiFi-related autotests, but we are working around this by sending two servo key presses with a 500ms delay between them to wake the system, instead of just one.

title.$t: [chrome.mdns] add chrome.mdns.refresh function

content.$t:
There are use cases where we want to do an active query for DNS-SD services, bypassing cache, instead of waiting for passive discovery to succeed.  For example, if the user is interactively browsing for services.

This FR is to add a refresh() method to the chrome.mdns API that acts similarly to when a listener is added to and removed from the API.

title.$t: Need to add support for enabling/disabling autofill wallet sync on the fly

content.$t: Currently the sync experiment requires a restart of the client before taking effect. This leads to a poor experience during testing and rollout, so we should make this happen on the fly. A corollary is that we should also be able to kill the experiment on the fly without needing a restart for the purpose of protecting the server.

title.$t: Android WebView ScrollTo is wrong when scroll offset is big.

content.$t:
To illustrate the problem I've created a test app. See the attachment (java and apk file).

I loaded an HTML page whose size is about 3648x3648. Then I tried to scroll the webview to (625, 2000) with button #1 or (625, 625) with button #2.

You will see the 2nd button succeeds in scrolling the webview to (625, 625) while the 1st button merely scrolls the webview to (0, 536).

This same issue has caused a CTS test to fail. (WebViewTest#testRequestChildRectangleOnScreen, see crbug.com/464693)

I further investigated the issue and put some logs in cc/.
The problem lies in LayerTreeImpl::GetDelegatedScrollOffset.
The outer viewport scroll layer has a maximum offset of (1256, 732), which is exceeded by button #1, which is a scroll offset of (312.5, 1000) in dip.
As a result, LayerTreeImpl::GetDelegatedScrollOffset ends up returning just the inner viewport scroll offset, which is (0, 268). 
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/cc/trees/layer_tree_impl.cc&l=1132

Then the scroll offset in BrowserViewRenderer is set to (0, 268).
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/cc/layers/layer_impl.cc&l=1124

So the total scroll offset (312.5, 1000) from the scroll delegate (Browser view renderer in this case) is never distributed between the inner and outer viewports.

Note 1: the button #1 does not even try to scroll the webview beyond its boundary (which is about 3648 x 3648).
Note 2: the maximum scroll offset is calculated here:
https://code.google.com/p/chromium/codesearch#chromium/src/cc/layers/layer_impl.cc&l=1236


Bo and Alex, any ideas?

title.$t: ARC: Refactor InstallerConnection.java to call commands.c

content.$t:
Currently InstallerConnection.java (mods/android/frameworks/base/core/java/com/android/internal/os/) reimplements a lot of the code in commands.c (third_party/android/frameworks/native/cmds/installd/).

We could reduce the code duplication by compiling commands.c (and related files) into libandroid and add in jni bridging code. We would need to modify commands.c to call ARC's ChildPluginSpawner. We would also need to modify upstream InstallerConnection.java to call directly into commands.c.

title.$t: Improve CC frame timing UMA histograms.

content.$t:
Currently we record histograms Renderer4.CompositorThreadImplDrawDelay/Renderer4.SoftwareCompositorThreadImplDrawDelay in FrameRateCounter::SaveTimeStamp().

Those histograms record deltas between frames, but I think they do not discriminate cases where frames are "delayed" because there is nothing to do, for example if there is no user input for 5 seconds then we generate a 5 second histogram.

It seems we could do better by using scheduler state, measuring from the beginning of a frame when there was activity.

title.$t: getStartPositionOfChar() and related API return wrong results for svg text nodes with rtl text.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.101 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Try finding first character position of SVG text node.
2. For LTR (e.g. English) the result is correct
3. For RTL (e.g. Hebrew) the result is incorrect

What is the expected behavior?
working sample:
http://jsfiddle.net/e_neko/x5t28hfL/

the spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/text.html#__svg__SVGTextContentElement__getStartPositionOfChar

Spec says the returned result should be the real position of character in user coordinate space (e.g. viewBox, if no transform is applied).
Indeed, in Firefox and IE the location reported for the first character is at the end of the line (~38 units).

What went wrong?
In chrome, the first character location reported is 0, as if some implicit transformation was applied to the element.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.101  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

I found no other way to detect if given text node is internally flipped or not. This will interfere with click detection, for example, if a specific character is of interest.

title.$t: Password saving intermittently fails for nytimes.com

content.$t:
1) Go to nytimes.com
2) Click login button in the top right
3) Fill in credentials and submit

Occasionally password will be saved, generally it won't be.

The problem is that during form submission, the onsubmit handler seems to create a new form which didn't exist on the page, populate it with data from the form the user interacted with, and then submits that form. We detect that the new form exists, but most of the time (especially for non SQL password stores) fetching from the store hasn't completed by the time that submission happens. So we drop the submission.

I'm wondering if there is really any reason to drop password saving in this case. I can see how it cuts down on possible false positives if there is some case where the site does a form submission automatically without user input, but I don't know if such cases exist. UMA stats show that this failure case is pretty infrequent, so the likelihood of major false positives is low. Removing this restriction seems like the easiest way to fix nytimes.com

It seems reasonable to collect this information periodically (see UserMetricsRecorder::RecordPeriodicMetrics()).

title.$t: Ryu: Implement PD_NO_DEBUG GPIO setting logic

content.$t:
Currently the Ryu EC does not set the PD_NO_DEBUG gpio correctly.  It initializes it high, and never touches it, which is safe (the Silego latches the high signal and all access to the SPI Flash from the EC is disabled) but prevents the case closed debugging path from reflashing the AP BIOS.

I believe the correct behavior that should be implemented is:

1) Initialize the GPIO to low
2) Set the GPIO high in a SYSJUMP hook if the hardware write protect signal is asserted, but leave it low if it is not.

Randall, Vic and/or Vincent, can you confirm the above behavior is correct?

title.$t: Split TransportSecurityState::DomainState into PKPState and STSState

content.$t:
Filing a bug for the TODO:

https://codereview.chromium.org/826423009 fixed a host of issues around STSState and PKPState not being treated independently. However, the states itself are still together in DomainState, both because of our preload data putting them together and the on-disk representation keeps them together.

This makes the GetDynamicDomainState logic rather confusing, as it has to query the two halves independently and stitch them back together. We should split them apart, in-memory and ideally on-disk as well.
